</DOCUMENT>
<DOCUMENT>
<TYPE>EX-10.E
<SEQUENCE>4
<FILENAME>w06406exv10we.htm
<DESCRIPTION>ADVANTA CORP. SUPPLEMENTAL EXECUTIVE RETIREMENT PLAN
<TEXT>
<HTML>
<HEAD>
<TITLE>exv10we</TITLE>
</HEAD>
<BODY bgcolor="#FFFFFF">
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>
<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">



<P align="right" style="font-size: 10pt">Exhibit&nbsp;10 - e



<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">Summary of Advanta Corp. Supplemental Executive Retirement Plan



<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">On February&nbsp;11, 2005, the Compensation Committee of the Board of Directors of Advanta Corp. and the
Board of Directors approved and established the Advanta Corp. Supplemental Executive Retirement
Plan (the &#147;SERP&#148;). The SERP was established in order to provide Dennis Alter, Chairman and Chief
Executive Officer, with certain retirement benefits in recognition of his more than 45&nbsp;years of
service to the Company. Subject to the vesting requirements described below, under the terms of
the SERP, Mr.&nbsp;Alter will be entitled to an annual retirement benefit of $625,000 upon reaching age
70 for his and his spouse&#146;s lives. The amount payable was determined based on a percentage of Mr.
Alter&#146;s 2001 base salary and target bonus. The annual benefit vests ratably over an eight year
period beginning in 2005. In the event of death, disability or a change in control, as defined in
the SERP, the annual benefit will become fully vested and immediately payable. In the event of a
change in control, Mr.&nbsp;Alter is also entitled to receive a gross up for excise taxes that arise and
for the reimbursement for such taxes.




<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;
</DIV>

</BODY>
</HTML>
</TEXT>
</DOCUMENT>
<DOCUMENT>
<TYPE>EX-10.H
<SEQUENCE>5
<FILENAME>w06406exv10wh.htm
<DESCRIPTION>SUMMARY OF LIFE INSURANCE BENEFITS FOR DIRECTORS AND EXECUTIVES
<TEXT>
<HTML>
<HEAD>
<TITLE>exv10wh</TITLE>
</HEAD>
<BODY bgcolor="#FFFFFF">
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>
<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">



<P align="right" style="font-size: 10pt">Exhibit&nbsp;10-h



<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt"><U><B>Summary of Life Insurance Benefits for Directors and Executives</B></U>



<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">The Company pays the premiums for life insurance policies on the lives of non-employee Directors.
The Board member has the right to designate the beneficiary under the applicable life insurance
policy. Each non-employee Director is eligible to receive a $500,000 policy. The policies
insuring the non-employee Directors are term life insurance policies, on which there is no build-up
in cash value.



<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">In 1993, the Company established as an executive benefit a split dollar life insurance program for certain
of the Company&#146;s executive officers. The agreements used for this program are substantially in the
form attached hereto. In connection with the split dollar life insurance program, the Company
agreed to make premium payments on life insurance policies purchased for the benefit of certain of
its executives. The executive officer has the right to designate the beneficiary under the
policies. If either party terminates the agreement, the executive must pay the Company the amount
of premiums paid by or on behalf of the Company but not more than the cash value of the life
insurance policy. Upon the death of an insured executive, the Company is entitled to receive, out
of the proceeds of the policy, the amount of its cash investment in the policies. Effective July
30, 2002, in response to the enactment of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002, the Company stopped
paying the premiums associated with the life insurance policies purchased for the split dollar life
insurance program. Presently there are split dollar life insurance policies in place for three of
the Company&#146;s executives which are expected to pay death benefits aggregating approximately $68
million.



<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">In addition to the insurance benefits described above, the Company provides a $1,000,000 term life
insurance benefit for certain senior management employees.



<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">




<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><B>SPLIT DOLLAR INSURANCE AGREEMENT</B>



<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;SPLIT DOLLAR INSURANCE AGREEMENT dated as of &#95;&#95;&#95;&#95;&#95;&#95;&#95;&#95;&#95;by and between
&#95;&#95;&#95;&#95;&#95;&#95;&#95;&#95;&#95;(the &#147;Owner&#148;) and ADVANTA CORP. (&#147;Company&#148;).


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The parties hereto in consideration of the agreements and covenants hereinafter set forth and
intending to be legally bound, agree as follows:


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.&nbsp;This agreement relates to &#091;insert applicable policy numbers&#093; on the life of &#091;name of
exectutive&#093; (&#147;Insured&#148;) issued by &#091;name of insurance company&#093; (&#147;Insurer&#148;). The Policies have been
included as part of a split-dollar life insurance arrangement established by the Company on &#091;insert
date&#093;. Subject to the conditions hereinafter set forth, the Owner shall be the sole owner of the
Policies.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2. The Company has heretofore and shall continue to pay the portion of the annual premiums on
the Policies equal to: (i)&nbsp;the annual net premiums, <U>minus</U> (ii)&nbsp;the value of the death
benefits to which the Owner is then entitled, determined by using the lesser of (a)&nbsp;the applicable
one-year term premium cost computed under <U>Revenue Ruling 55-747</U>, 1955-2 C.B. 228 (or any
superseding ruling thereto) or (b)&nbsp;the applicable premium rates charged by the Insurer for initial
issue one-year term insurance. The Owner shall pay to the Company in connection with the Policies,
or directly to the Insurer, the amount described in clause (ii)&nbsp;above, and such payments shall
continue to be made to the Company notwithstanding the fact that there are no annual net premiums
on the Policies or that the Company&#146;s obligation to pay premiums is satisfied by distributions from
the Policies. In any year, the &#147;annual net premiums&#148; shall equal the gross premiums


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">less Policy dividends, which are not used to purchase additional insurance. The aggregate of
such Company payments, reduced by amounts received by the Company with respect to the Policies, is
hereinafter referred to as the Company&#146;s &#147;Cash Investment&#148; in the Policies. The Company shall also
pay to or on behalf of &#091;name of executive&#093; a bonus equal to the amount described in clause (ii)
above.



<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3.&nbsp;In consideration of the payments made pursuant to paragraph 2 hereof, the Company shall
receive from the proceeds of the Policies, upon the death of the Insured (or upon the surrender of
the Policies during the Insured&#146;s lifetime) an amount equal to the Company&#146;s Cash Investment in the
Policies, as calculated under paragraph 2 hereof. The balance of the proceeds, if any, shall be
paid as provided by the Owner in the Policies.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.&nbsp;To secure the Cash Investment, the Owner shall assign to the Company a security interest in
the Policies equal in amount to the Cash Investment and such security interest shall be limited to
the Company&#146;s right to receive such amount out of the proceeds of the Policies.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;5.&nbsp;The assignment to the Company provided for in this agreement shall be effectuated by the
execution of a Collateral Assignment Agreement substantially in the form attached hereto as Exhibit
&#147;A&#148;.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;6.&nbsp;The Owner shall notify the Insurer of the Collateral Assignment Agreement and shall take no
action that would impair the security interest of the Company under the Collateral Assignment
Agreement.


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;7.&nbsp;Each and every right, interest or incident of ownership associated with the Policies which
are not expressly assigned to the Company by the Collateral Assignment Agreement shall be retained
by the Owner, including, but not limited to, the right to designate and change the beneficiaries of
the Policies, the right to transfer the Policies subject to the rights assigned to the Company, the
right to surrender the Policies subject to the rights assigned to the Company, and the right to
exercise any option provided in the Policies.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;8.&nbsp;Subject to taking notice of the Collateral Assignment Agreement when it is filed at its
home office, the Insurer shall have no obligation except as set forth in the Policies. The Insurer
shall not be bound to inquire into or take notice of any of the covenants herein contained. Upon
the Insured&#146;s death (or upon surrender of the Policies prior to the death of the Insured), the
Insurer shall be discharged from its obligations upon payment of the proceeds in accordance with
the provisions of the Policies and the Collateral Assignment Agreement and without regard to this
agreement or any amendment hereof.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;9.&nbsp;For purposes of the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974, as amended (&#147;ERISA&#148;),
the Company is the &#147;Named Fiduciary&#148; and &#147;Administrator&#148; within the meaning of sections 402(a) and
3(16)(A) of ERISA, respectively, and the fiduciary for deciding claims. All claims shall be
resolved under procedures that comply with regulations promulgated under section 503 of ERISA.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;10.&nbsp;This agreement may be terminated at any time while the Insured is living by written notice
thereof by either the Company or the Owner to the other. As of


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">the date of such termination, the Company shall be repaid its Cash Investment solely to the
extent of funds available from the Policies, the Company shall have no further rights in the
Policies and the Collateral Assignment Agreement shall be terminated.



<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;11.&nbsp;Amendments may be made to this agreement by a writing signed by each of the parties and
attached hereto.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;12.&nbsp;All matters respecting the validity, effect and interpretation of this agreement shall be
determined in accordance with the laws of the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;13.&nbsp;This agreement shall be binding upon the parties hereto and their successors and assigns.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;IN WITNESS WHEREOF, this agreement has been executed on &#95;&#95;&#95;&#95;&#95;&#95;&#95;&#95;&#95;, &#95;&#95;&#95;.

<DIV align="center">
<TABLE style="font-size: 10pt" cellspacing="0" border="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%">

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">


<P align="right" style="font-size: 10pt"><B>Exhibit&nbsp;A</B>



<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><B>COLLATERAL ASSIGNMENT AGREEMENT</B>



<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;COLLATERAL ASSIGNMENT AGREEMENT dated as of &#95;&#95;&#95;&#95;&#95;&#95;&#95;&#95;&#95;, by and between
&#95;&#95;&#95;&#95;&#95;&#95;&#95;&#95;&#95;(&#147;Owner&#148;), and ADVANTA CORP. (&#147;Company&#148;).


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This Agreement relates to &#091;name of insurance company&#093; (&#147;Insurer&#148;) Policy No. &#95;&#95;&#95;&#95;&#95;&#95;&#95;&#95;&#95;,
(&#147;Policy&#148;) on the life of &#091;name of executive&#093;, (&#147;Insured&#148;).


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The parties have entered into a Split Dollar Insurance Agreement (&#147;Insurance Agreement&#148;)
relating to this Collateral Assignment Agreement.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Pursuant to the Insurance Agreement, the Owner has agreed to assign to the Company a security
interest in the Policy in order to provide for the payment to the Company of the Cash Investment,
as defined in the Insurance Agreement.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The parties hereto, in consideration of the foregoing and the agreements and covenants
hereinafter set forth and intending to be legally bound hereby, agree as follows:


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.&nbsp;The Owner hereby assigns to the Company a security interest in the Policy in order to
secure for the Company the payment of the Cash Investment in the Policy, consisting of the
following rights:


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;Upon the death of the Insured, the Company shall have the right to receive so much of the
proceeds payable under the Policy as is equal to the Cash Investment, determined as of the date of
the Insured&#146;s death. The Company may collect such portion of the proceeds directly from the
Insurer.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;In the event the Policy is surrendered by the Owner prior to the death of the Insured, the
Company shall have the right to receive so much of the proceeds received as is equal to the Cash
Investment, determined as of the date of surrender. The Company may collect such portion of the
proceeds on surrender of the Policy directly from the Insurer.


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.&nbsp;The Insurer is authorized to rely solely on the written statement of the Company and the
Owner for the exercise of any rights under the Policy assigned herein and as to the amount of the
Cash Investment as of any date. The Insurer is hereby authorized to recognize such statement
without investigation or the giving of any notice. The written acknowledgment of receipt by the
Company for any sums paid to it by the Insurer pursuant to the written statement of the Cash
Investment in the Policy shall be a full discharge and release of the Insurer with respect to the
Company&#146;s interest in the Policy. Payment of the Cash Investment shall be made to the exclusive
order of the Company.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3.&nbsp;Each and every right, interest or incident of ownership associated with the Policy which
is not expressly assigned to the Company by this Collateral Assignment Agreement is retained by the
Owner, including, but not limited to, the right to designate and change the beneficiaries of the
Policy, the right to transfer the Policy subject to the rights assigned to the Company, the right
to surrender the Policy subject to the rights assigned to the Company, and the right to exercise
any option provided in the Policy.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.&nbsp;Each of the undersigned declares that no proceedings in bankruptcy are pending against it
or them and that its or their property is not subject to any assignment for the benefit of
creditors.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;5.&nbsp;All matters respecting the validity, effect and interpretation of this Collateral
Assignment Agreement shall be determined in accordance with the laws of the Commonwealth of
Pennsylvania.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;6.&nbsp;This Collateral Assignment Agreement shall be binding upon the parties hereto and their
successors and assigns.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the parties have hereunto set their hands and seals on &#95;&#95;&#95;&#95;&#95;&#95;&#95;&#95;&#95;,
&#95;&#95;&#95;&#95;&#95;&#95;&#95;&#95;&#95;.

<DIV align="center">

<DOCUMENT>
<TYPE>EX-10.N.1
<SEQUENCE>6
<FILENAME>w06406exv10wnw1.htm
<DESCRIPTION>SIXTH AMENDMENT TO COMMERCIAL LEASE
<TEXT>
<HTML>
<HEAD>
<TITLE>exv10wnw1</TITLE>
</HEAD>
<BODY bgcolor="#FFFFFF">
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>
<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">



<P align="right" style="font-size: 10pt">Exhibit&nbsp;10-n.1



<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">SIXTH AMENDMENT TO COMMERCIAL LEASE<BR>
&#091;CarrAmerica Realty, L.P./Advanta Bank Corp.&#093;



<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;THIS SIXTH AMENDMENT (this &#147;<U>Amendment</U>&#148;) is entered into as of the 6<SUP style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: text-top">th</SUP> day of
December, 2004, between CARRAMERICA REALTY, L.P., a Delaware limited partnership
(&#147;<U>Landlord</U>&#148;), whose address is 1850 K Street, N.W., Suite&nbsp;500, Washington, D.C. 20006, and
ADVANTA BANK CORP., a Utah corporation, formerly known as Advanta Financial Corp.
(&#147;<U>Tenant</U>&#148;), whose address is 11850 South Election Road, Draper, Utah 84020. (Landlord and
Tenant are referred to in this Amendment collectively as the &#147;<U>Parties</U>.&#148;)


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;FOR THE SUM OF TEN DOLLARS ($10.00) and other good and valuable consideration, the receipt and
sufficiency of which are acknowledged, the Parties agree as follows:


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.&nbsp;<U>Definitions</U>. As used in this Amendment, each of the following terms shall have the
indicated meaning, and any capitalized term that is used but not defined in this Amendment shall
have the meaning set forth in the Lease (as defined below in this <U>Paragraph&nbsp;1</U>):


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.1. &#147;<U>Additional Space</U>&#148; means the additional space located on the second floor of the
Building being added to the Existing Space by this Amendment, shown on the attached <U>Exhibit
A</U>, consisting of approximately 5,093 rentable square feet.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.2. &#147;<U>Delivered</U>&#148; means, with respect to any Additional Space, the earlier of either of
the following: (a)&nbsp;the date on which such Additional Space is delivered by Landlord to Tenant with
Substantial Completion of the tenant improvements described in <U>Paragraph&nbsp;7</U> of this
Amendment; or (b)&nbsp;the date on which Tenant first conducts business in such Additional Space.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.3. &#147;<U>Existing Space</U>&#148; means the space covered by the Lease prior to this Amendment.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.4. &#147;<U>Expansion Date(s)</U>&#148; means the date(s) on which all or any portion of the
Additional Space is Delivered, which is anticipated to occur on or about December&nbsp;15, 2004 for the
portion of the Additional Space located on the eastern side of the Building, consisting of
approximately 2,579 rentable square feet, and January&nbsp;15, 2005 for the portion of the Additional
Space located on the western side of the Building, consisting of approximately 2,514 rentable
square feet.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.5. &#147;<U>Lease</U>&#148; means the Commercial Lease, dated September&nbsp;28, 1995, as previously
amended by the First Amendment to Lease, dated February&nbsp;13, 1996, the Second Amendment to Lease
(the &#147;<U>Second Amendment</U>&#148;), dated May&nbsp;20, 1996, the Third Amendment to Commercial Lease, dated
October&nbsp;27, 2000, the Fourth Amendment to Commercial Lease, dated May&nbsp;3, 2001, and the Fifth
Amendment to Commercial Lease, dated February&nbsp;28, 2002, all entered


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">



<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">into between Landlord or its predecessor in interest, Draper Park North, L.C., a Utah limited
liability company, as landlord, and Tenant, as tenant.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.&nbsp;<U>Purpose</U>. The Parties desire to (a)&nbsp;expand the Existing Space to add the Additional
Space, (b)&nbsp;extend the term of the Lease, and (c)&nbsp;provide to Tenant additional options to extend the
term of the Lease, all in accordance with the terms and conditions of this Amendment.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3.&nbsp;<U>Term</U>. The Lease term shall expire on April&nbsp;30, 2010, unless extended in accordance
with <U>Paragraph&nbsp;9</U> of this Amendment or sooner terminated in accordance with the Lease, as
amended by this Amendment. <U>Article&nbsp;2(b)</U> of the Lease shall have no further force or effect.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.&nbsp;<U>Premises</U>. As of the Expansion Date(s), the Additional Space then being Delivered
shall be added to the Existing Space, and on and after the date on which all of the Additional
Space is Delivered to Tenant, the &#147;Premises&#148; shall mean and consist of approximately 56,360
rentable square feet in the aggregate, as shown on the table attached as <U>Exhibit&nbsp;B</U>.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;5.&nbsp;<U>Base Rent</U>.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;5.1. For the period expiring on April&nbsp;30, 2005, the Base Rent for the Existing Space shall be
as set forth in the Lease, without reference to this Amendment.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;5.2. For the three (3)&nbsp;month period after any Additional Space is Delivered, no Base Rent
shall be payable by Tenant to Landlord for such Additional Space. On the first day of the first
month following such three (3)&nbsp;month period, and on the first day of any month thereafter (if any)
prior to May&nbsp;1, 2005, Tenant shall pay to Landlord Base Rent on such Additional Space at the rate
of $15.95 per rentable square foot of such Additional Space for the period commencing on the day
after the expiration of such three (3)&nbsp;month period and expiring on April&nbsp;30, 2005.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;5.3. On and after May&nbsp;1, 2005, the Base Rent payable under the Lease (as amended by this
Amendment) for the Premises shall be as follows:

<DIV align="center">
<TABLE style="font-size: 10pt" cellspacing="0" border="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%">
<!-- Begin Table Head -->
<TR valign="bottom">
    <TD width="16%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="2%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="24%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="2%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="24%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="2%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="24%">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 8pt" valign="bottom">
    <TD nowrap align="center"><U>Dates</U></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD nowrap align="left"><U>Annual Rent</U></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD nowrap align="left"><U>Monthly Rent</U></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD nowrap align="left"><U>Annual Rent Per RSF</U></TD>
</TR>

<!-- End Table Head -->
<!-- Begin Table Body -->
<TR valign="bottom" style="background: #cceeff">
    <TD><DIV style="margin-left:15px; text-indent:-15px">5-01-05 to 4-30-06</DIV></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">-2-
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;6.&nbsp;<U>Operating Expenses</U>. With respect to (i)&nbsp;the Existing Space for the period on and
after May&nbsp;1, 2005, and (ii)&nbsp;the Additional Space:


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;6.1. The Base Year shall be calendar year 2004, subject to adjustment to a level of 95%
occupancy as set forth in <U>Article&nbsp;7(b)(i)</U> of the Lease.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;6.2. <U>Article&nbsp;7(b)(iv)</U> of the Lease and all references to the Cap in the Lease are
deleted and shall have no further force or effect. However, with respect to (i)&nbsp;the Existing Space
for the period on and after May&nbsp;1, 2005, and (ii)&nbsp;the Additional Space, the following shall be
applicable to the Operating Expenses Escalation payable by Tenant under the Lease:


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;The Operating Expenses Escalation for Controllable Operating Expenses (defined below)
applicable to calendar year 2005 shall be the lesser of (i)&nbsp;Tenant&#146;s Prorata Share of Controllable
Operating Expenses for calendar year 2005, less Tenant&#146;s Prorata Share of Controllable Operating
Expenses for calendar year 2004, or (ii)&nbsp;the sum of Tenant&#146;s Prorata Share of Controllable
Operating Expenses for calendar year 2004, plus five percent (5%) (such sum is the initial &#147;<U>Cap
Amount</U>&#148;), less Tenant&#146;s Prorata Share of Controllable Operating Expenses for calendar year
2004; <U>provided</U>, <U>however</U>, that Tenant&#146;s Prorata Share of Controllable Operating
Expenses for calendar year 2004 shall be adjusted by Landlord to the amount that Landlord
reasonably believes it would have been if ninety-five percent (95%) of the rentable area of the
Building had been occupied.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;The Operating Expenses Escalation for Controllable Operating Expenses applicable to each
calendar year thereafter shall be the lesser of (i)&nbsp;Tenant&#146;s Prorata Share of Controllable
Operating Expenses for the applicable calendar year, less Tenant&#146;s Prorata Share of Controllable
Operating Expenses for calendar year 2004, or (ii)&nbsp;the sum of the Cap Amount for the immediately
preceding calendar year, plus five percent (5%), less Tenant&#146;s Prorata Share of Controllable
Operating Expenses for calendar year 2004.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(c)&nbsp;&#147;<U>Controllable Operating Expenses</U>&#148; means all Operating Expenses other than those
costs that are not within the control of Landlord. Those costs that are not within the control of
Landlord include, without limitation, insurance, electricity and other utilities and janitorial
expenses. There is no cap on Operating Expenses other than Controllable Operating Expenses, or on
Real Estate Taxes.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(d)&nbsp;Assume, for example, Tenant&#146;s Prorata Share of Controllable Operating Expenses for
calendar year 2004 is $100.00. In calendar year 2005, the Operating Expenses Escalation for
Controllable Operating Expenses would be the lesser of (i)&nbsp;Tenant&#146;s Prorata Share of Controllable
Operating Expenses for calendar year 2005, less $100.00, or (ii) $5.00 ($100.00 plus five percent
(5%), less $100.00). In calendar year 2006, the Operating Expenses Escalation for Controllable
Operating Expenses would be the lesser of (i)&nbsp;Tenant&#146;s Prorata Share of Controllable Operating
Expenses for calendar year 2006, less $100.00, or (ii) $10.25 ($105.00 plus five percent (5%), less
$100.00), and so on.


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">-3-
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(e)&nbsp;All calculations made under this <U>Paragraph&nbsp;6.2</U> shall take into account, and be
adjusted for, any partial calendar year periods, and any periods in which there is a difference in
the number of rentable square feet comprising the Premises.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;6.3. The exclusion of electric and gas expenses from Operating Expenses is deleted, meaning
that electric and gas expenses shall be included in Operating Expenses.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;6.4. Tenant may be billed separately for, and if billed shall pay to Landlord within thirty
(30)&nbsp;days after receipt of an itemized invoice therefor, the actual cost of any utilities used
during any period other than Monday through Friday from 8:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m., as such cost is
reasonably estimated and determined by Landlord.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;7.&nbsp;<U>Tenant Improvements&#151;Additional Space</U>. Landlord shall, as soon as reasonably
practicable, at its sole cost and expense, improve the Additional Space by demising, constructing,
wiring, painting and carpeting or tiling, as appropriate, in accordance with the space plan
attached as <U>Exhibit&nbsp;C</U>, using the Building standard materials described on <U>Exhibit
C.1</U>.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;8.&nbsp;<U>Parking Stalls</U>. Pursuant to <U>Article&nbsp;1(d)</U> of the Lease, commencing on the
Expansion Date(s), Landlord shall provide Tenant with six additional non-reserved parking stalls
per 1,000 rentable square feet of the Additional Space Delivered in the parking lots adjacent to
the Building. When all of the Additional Space has been Delivered, Landlord shall provide Tenant
with a total of 327 non-reserved parking stalls and 11 reserved parking stalls in the parking lots
adjacent to the Building.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;9.&nbsp;<U>Options to Extend</U>. Subject to the balance of this <U>Paragraph&nbsp;9</U>, Tenant may,
at its option, extend the term of the Lease for the entire Premises for three (3)&nbsp;periods of two
(2)&nbsp;years each (each, an &#147;<U>Extension Term</U>&#148;) upon the same terms contained in the Lease (other
than tenant improvements made previously by Landlord), except for the amount of Base Rent payable
during each Extension Term. Tenant shall have no additional extension options, unless otherwise
agreed by the Parties in a written agreement entered into by the Parties after the date of this
Amendment.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;9.1. The Base Rent during each Extension Term shall be the greater of (a)&nbsp;the Base Rent
applicable to the last day of the term of the Lease prior to the applicable Extension Term, or (b)
the then-prevailing market rate for a comparable term commencing on the first day of the Extension
Term for tenants of comparable size and creditworthiness for comparable space in the Building and
other first-class office buildings in the vicinity of the Building as reasonably determined by
Landlord.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;9.2. To exercise its option, Tenant must deliver an initial non-binding notice to Landlord not
less than nine (9)&nbsp;months prior to the proposed commencement of the applicable Extension Term. At
some point between ten (10)&nbsp;and eight (8)&nbsp;months prior to the proposed commencement of the
applicable Extension Term, Landlord shall calculate and inform Tenant of


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">-4-
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">



<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">the Base Rent for the Premises. Such calculation shall be final and shall not be recalculated
at the actual commencement of the Extension Term, if any. Tenant shall give Landlord final binding
notice of intent to exercise its option to extend within fifteen (15)&nbsp;days after receiving
Landlord&#146;s calculation of Base Rent. If Tenant fails to give either its initial non-binding notice
or its final binding notice timely, Tenant will be deemed to have waived that option (and any other
option) to extend.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;9.3. Tenant&#146;s option to extend the Lease is subject to the conditions that: (a)&nbsp;on the date
that Tenant delivers its final binding notice exercising its option to extend, Tenant is not in
default under the Lease beyond the expiration of any applicable notice and cure periods; and (b)
Tenant shall not have assigned the Lease or sublet any portion of the Premises under a sublease
which is in effect at any time during the final twelve (12)&nbsp;months prior to the applicable
Extension Term, but excluding any assignment or sublease to an affiliate of Tenant. As used in the
immediately preceding sentence, &#147;<U>affiliate</U>&#148; means an entity that controls, is controlled by,
or is under common control with, Tenant, where &#147;<U>control</U>&#148; is the holding of fifty percent
(50%) or more of the outstanding voting interests.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;10.&nbsp;<U>Tenant Improvements&#151;Existing Space</U>. With respect to the Existing Space, Landlord
shall:


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;10.1. repaint the first floor;


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;10.2. pay Tenant for the actual, reasonable costs paid or incurred by Tenant in replacing the
carpeting on the first floor of the Building with carpet tiles, such payment (a)&nbsp;to be made by
Landlord to Tenant within ten (10)&nbsp;days after receipt by Landlord of third-party invoices for
completed work, and (b)&nbsp;not to exceed One Hundred Five Thousand Dollars ($105,000);


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;10.3. replace the doors at both ends of the restroom corridor located on the first floor of
the Building;


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;10.4. install protective bollards near the electricity transformer and emergency generator
located outside of the Building near its Southwest corner;


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;10.5. separate the HVAC system for the mailroom/receiving area;


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;10.6. increase the illumination of certain areas outside the Building and in the parking lot
as may be determined by Landlord; <U>provided</U>, <U>however</U>, that by undertaking to increase
such illumination, Landlord is not in any way undertaking or assuming any additional obligation
(including, without limitation, any additional obligation with respect to security or safety) with
respect to Tenant, Tenant&#146;s employees or any other person; and


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;10.7. pay Tenant for the actual, reasonable costs paid or incurred by Tenant in enhancing its
security, such payment (a)&nbsp;to be made by Landlord to Tenant within ten (10)&nbsp;days


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">-5-
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">



<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">after receipt by Landlord of third-party invoices for completed work, and (b)&nbsp;not to exceed Three
Thousand Dollars ($3,000).


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;11.&nbsp;<U>Security Station</U>. On or before January&nbsp;15, 2005, Tenant shall, at its sole cost
and expense, and in accordance with all applicable provisions of the Lease including, without
limitation, <U>Article&nbsp;8</U> of the Lease, and after obtaining Landlord&#146;s prior written approval of
the drawings for such work, relocate its existing security station (currently located in the lobby
of the Building) to a space within the Existing Space adjoining the front door vestibule, with a
window in the wall of the vestibule.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;12.&nbsp;<U>Right of First Refusal</U>. The Parties confirm that the &#147;Right of First Refusal&#148;
described in <U>Paragraph&nbsp;2</U> of the Second Amendment remains in full force and effect in
accordance with its terms.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;13.&nbsp;<U>General Provisions</U>. In the event of any conflict between the provisions of the
Lease and the provisions of this Amendment, the provisions of this Amendment shall control. As
modified by this Amendment, the Lease and all of Tenant&#146;s obligations under the Lease are ratified
and affirmed in their entirety. This Amendment shall inure to the benefit of, and be binding on,
the Parties and their respective successors and assigns. This Amendment shall be governed by, and
construed and interpreted in accordance with, the laws (excluding the choice of laws rules) of the
state of Utah. This Amendment may be executed in any number of duplicate originals or
counterparts, each of which when so executed shall constitute in the aggregate but one and the same
document. Each individual executing this Amendment represents and warrants that such individual
has been duly authorized to execute and deliver this Amendment in the capacity and for the entity
set forth where such individual signs. Each exhibit referred to in, and attached to, this
Amendment is an integral part of this Amendment and is incorporated in this Amendment by this
reference.


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">-6-
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;THE PARTIES have executed this Amendment on the respective dates set forth below, to be
effective as of the date first set forth above.

</DIV></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
    <TD valign="top"><DIV style="margin-left:0px; text-indent:-0px">
</DIV></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">Date
</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;12/13/04</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1px">
    <TD valign="top"><DIV style="margin-left:0px; text-indent:-0px">
</DIV></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>
<!-- End Table Body -->
</TABLE>
</DIV>


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">-7-
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><U>EXHIBIT A</U>



<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">to



<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">SIXTH AMENDMENT TO COMMERCIAL LEASE<BR>
<BR>
<DIV style="border-bottom: 1px solid #000000; font-size: 1px">&nbsp;</DIV>



<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">ADDITIONAL SPACE



<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Additional Space referred to in the foregoing instrument is shown on the attachment,
consisting of one page.


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">-8-
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><U>EXHIBIT B</U>



<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">to



<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">SIXTH AMENDMENT TO COMMERCIAL LEASE



<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><DIV style="border-bottom: 1px solid #000000; font-size: 1px">&nbsp;</DIV>



<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">BOMA TABLE



<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The table showing the total rentable square footage of the Premises referred to in the
foregoing instrument is attached and consists of one page.


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">-9-
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><U>EXHIBIT C</U>



<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">to



<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">SIXTH AMENDMENT TO COMMERCIAL LEASE



<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><DIV style="border-bottom: 1px solid #000000; font-size: 1px">&nbsp;</DIV>



<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">SPACE PLAN



<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The space plan referred to in the foregoing instrument is attached and consists of one page.


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">-10-
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><U>EXHIBIT C.1</U>



<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">to



<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">SIXTH AMENDMENT TO COMMERCIAL LEASE



<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><DIV style="border-bottom: 1px solid #000000; font-size: 1px">&nbsp;</DIV>



<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">BUILDING STANDARD MATERIALS



<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Building standard materials referred to in the foregoing instrument are described as
follows:


<P>
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">1.&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Standard interior office partitions will be as shown on the foregoing space plan. New walls
will be floor to underside of ceiling walls, consisting of 3-5/8&#148; metal studs, 24&#148; o.c. max
with staggered bracing 8&#146; o.c. max, 1 layer of 5/8&#148; standard gypsum board on each side and mud
set J bead on top of wall.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>


<P>
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">2.&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Existing and new demising walls are floor to underside of deck, consisting of 3-5/8&#148; metal
studs, 16&#148; o.c., 1 layer of 5/8&#148; standard gypsum board on each side, painted with smooth
finish and eggshell paint.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>


<P>
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">3.&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Floor finishes consist of Bigelow &#147;No Limits&#148;, or Bigelow &#147;No Barriers&#148; (or equivalent)
carpet in office areas and exercise room with 4&#148; rubber base. Existing VCT in &#147;File
Room/Check Printing Room&#148; will remain as is. Shower/Locker room floor finishes shall consist
of 2&#148; x 2&#148; ceramic tile flooring.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>


<P>
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">4.&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Existing ceilings consist of a 1&#148; nominal, low gloss white finish, intermediate duty grid
system with &#147;2&#146; x 2&#146; x 5/8&#148; tiles. Existing ceiling will be patched as necessary where new
walls are constructed. Ceiling tiles will be reused where possible.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>


<P>
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">5.&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Existing doors, frames and hardware consist of: 3&#146; x 7&#146; solid core stain grade oak veneer, as
manufactured by Weyerhaeuser or equal, field finished to match the existing base building
doors. Locksets shall match existing. All frames are 26 ga. hollow metal, knock down, steel
frames, painted to match building standard. All locks shall be keyed to base building master
key system with matching keyway and all doors shall have 2 pair of hinges and a wall or floor
bumper as appropriate.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>


<P>
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">6.&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Wall finishes: All new drywall surfaces shall be painted, with two coats to cover, in color
to match existing. Existing drywall surfaces will be touched up as necessary.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>


<P>
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">7.&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Window coverings are limited to existing blinds.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>


<P>
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">8.&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Specialties are limited to lockers, mirrors, and benches in men&#146;s and women&#146;s shower/locker
rooms. Lockers shall be double tier steel lockers with a maximum of 24 openings per locker
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">-11-
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<P><TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">


</TABLE>


<P align="left" style="margin-left: 4%; text-indent: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt">room. Benches shall be 1<FONT style="font-size: 70%"><SUP>1</SUP></FONT>/<FONT style="font-size: 60%">4</FONT>&#148; hardwood mounted on two steel pedestals. Mirror shall be unframed
wall mounted 24&#148; x 48&#148; max at the rate of one per locker/shower room.


<P>
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">9.&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Sprinkler system work is limited to reworking the base building sprinkler layout to meet NFPA
13 requirements for the attached layout. Existing sprinkler heads will be re-used. Shifting
or adding heads for aesthetic reasons is specifically excluded.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>


<P>
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">10.&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>HVAC consists of existing rooftop units with existing programmable thermostats, and an
exhaust fan to serve exercise and locker/shower rooms. Any supplemental HVAC for server room,
telephone room, exercise room, or other equipment rooms, if necessary, will be supplied and
maintained by Tenant.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>


<P>
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">11.&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Lighting provisions include utilization of existing 2&#146; x 2&#146; parabolic, 3&#148; deep 18 cell,
277-volt, 3-lamp fixtures with electronic ballasts. All offices, conference and individual
rooms shall have individual wall switches and open office areas shall have ganged lighting
switches. Shower stalls shall each have one wet location suitable can light.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>


<P>
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">12.&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Fire alarm system, emergency lighting, and exit signs shall be provided in accordance with
applicable codes.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>


<P>
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">13.&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Telephone and data provisions are limited to existing boxes and cabling. Termination devices
and any additional cabling shall be provided and connected by Tenant.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>


<P>
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">14.&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Electrical convenience outlets are existing. New walls will receive convenience outlets at
the rate of one per 10 feet.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>


<P>
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">15.&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Shower stalls shall be provided at the rate of 3 per shower/locker room. Stalls shall
consist of 4<FONT style="font-size: 70%"><SUP>1</SUP></FONT>/<FONT style="font-size: 60%">4</FONT>&#148; x 4<FONT style="font-size: 70%"><SUP>1</SUP></FONT>/<FONT style="font-size: 60%">4</FONT>&#148; Daltile Bright Glaze or Matte Series&nbsp;Price Group One (or equivalent) wall
tiles and 2x2 Daltile Keystone Price Group One (or equivalent) floor tiles. Wall tiles will
be provided in shower stalls only. All other locker room walls shall be painted drywall.
Floor tiles shall cover the entire floor of the locker room. One shower stall in each
shower/locker room shall have an ADA bench and showerhead installed.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">-12-
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">


<P><TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">



</TABLE>


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">CONSENT AND CONFIRMATION OF GUARANTOR



<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;THE UNDERSIGNED, ADVANTA CORP., a Delaware corporation, the guarantor of the Lease identified
in the foregoing Sixth Amendment to Commercial Lease, (i)&nbsp;consents to such amendment, (ii)&nbsp;agrees
that the undersigned&#146;s guaranty of the Lease is in full force and effect and will continue to apply
to the Lease, as amended by the foregoing amendment, or as otherwise amended on or after the date
of this instrument, and (iii)&nbsp;agrees that the undersigned has no defenses to the enforcement of
such guaranty, which is and shall continue to be enforceable in accordance with its terms.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;DATED: <U> December&nbsp;13</U>, 2004

<DOCUMENT>
<TYPE>EX-10.N.2
<SEQUENCE>7
<FILENAME>w06406exv10wnw2.htm
<DESCRIPTION>SEVENTH AMENDMENT TO COMMERCIAL LEASE
<TEXT>
<HTML>
<HEAD>
<TITLE>exv10wnw2</TITLE>
</HEAD>
<BODY bgcolor="#FFFFFF">
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>
<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">



<P align="right" style="font-size: 10pt">Exhibit&nbsp;10-n.2



<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">SEVENTH AMENDMENT TO COMMERCIAL LEASE



<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">&#091;CarrAmerica Realty, L.P./Advanta Bank Corp.&#093;



<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;THIS SEVENTH AMENDMENT (this &#147;<U>Amendment</U>&#148;) is entered into as of the 25<SUP style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: text-top">th</SUP> day
of January, 2005, between CARRAMERICA REALTY, L.P., a Delaware limited partnership
(&#147;<U>Landlord</U>&#148;), whose address is 1850 K Street, N.W., Suite&nbsp;500, Washington, D.C. 20006, and
ADVANTA BANK CORP., a Utah corporation, formerly known as Advanta Financial Corp.
(&#147;<U>Tenant</U>&#148;), whose address is 11850 South Election Road, Draper, Utah 84020. (Landlord and
Tenant are referred to in this Amendment collectively as the &#147;<U>Parties</U>,&#148; and individually as
a &#147;<U>Party</U>.&#148;)


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;FOR THE SUM OF TEN DOLLARS ($10.00) and other good and valuable consideration, the receipt and
sufficiency of which are acknowledged, the Parties agree as follows:


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.&nbsp;<U>Definitions</U>. As used in this Amendment, each of the following terms shall have the
indicated meaning, and any capitalized term that is used but not defined in this Amendment shall
have the meaning set forth in the Lease (as defined below in this <U>Paragraph&nbsp;1</U>):


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.1. &#147;<U>Final Expansion Date</U>&#148; means April&nbsp;1, 2005.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.2. &#147;<U>Lease</U>&#148; means the Commercial Lease, dated September&nbsp;28, 1995, as previously
amended by the First Amendment to Lease, dated February&nbsp;13, 1996, the Second Amendment to Lease,
dated May&nbsp;20, 1996, the Third Amendment to Commercial Lease, dated October&nbsp;27, 2000, the Fourth
Amendment to Commercial Lease, dated May&nbsp;3, 2001, the Fifth Amendment to Commercial Lease, dated
February&nbsp;28, 2002, and the Sixth Amendment to Commercial Lease (the &#147;<U>Sixth Amendment</U>&#148;),
dated December&nbsp;9, 2004, all entered into between Landlord or its predecessor in interest, Draper
Park North, L.C., a Utah limited liability company, as landlord, and Tenant, as tenant.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.3. &#147;<U>Previous Space</U>&#148; means the space covered by the Lease prior to this Amendment
(comprised of both the &#147;Existing Space&#148; and the &#147;Additional Space&#148; identified in the Sixth
Amendment), consisting of approximately 56,360 rentable square feet, plus any additional square
footage added by the expansion of the exercise facility pursuant to <U>Paragraph&nbsp;6</U> of this
Amendment.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.4. &#147;<U>Remaining Space</U>&#148; means the additional space located on the second floor of the
Building being added to the Previous Space by this Amendment, shown on the attached <U>Exhibit
A</U>, consisting of approximately 15,878 rentable square feet, minus any square footage added to
the Previous Space, as set forth in <U>Paragraph&nbsp;1.3</U> of this Amendment.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.&nbsp;<U>Purpose</U>. The Parties desire to expand the Previous Space to add the Remaining
Space, in accordance with the terms and conditions of this Amendment.


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3.&nbsp;<U>Premises</U>. As of the Final Expansion Date, the Remaining Space shall be added to the
Previous Space. As of the later of (a)&nbsp;the Final Expansion Date, and (b)&nbsp;the date on which all of
the Additional Space is Delivered to Tenant (as those terms are defined in the Sixth Amendment),
the &#147;Premises&#148; shall mean and consist of approximately 72,238 rentable square feet in the
aggregate.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.&nbsp;<U>Base Rent</U>.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.1. <U>Previous Space&#151;Prior to May&nbsp;1, 2005</U>. Tenant shall pay to Landlord Base Rent on
the Previous Space in accordance with the Lease, without reference to this Amendment, for the
period expiring on April&nbsp;30, 2005.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.2. <U>Remaining Space&#151;Prior to May&nbsp;1, 2005</U>. Tenant shall pay to Landlord Base Rent on
the Remaining Space at the rate of $15.95 per rentable square foot for the period commencing on the
Final Expansion Date and expiring on April&nbsp;30, 2005.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.3. <U>Premises&#151;On and after May&nbsp;1, 2005</U>. Tenant shall pay to Landlord Base Rent on the
Premises (comprised of both the Previous Space and the Remaining Space) on and after May&nbsp;1, 2005 in
accordance with the following schedule:

<DIV align="center">
<TABLE style="font-size: 10pt" cellspacing="0" border="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%">
<!-- Begin Table Head -->
<TR valign="bottom">
     <TD width="16%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="2%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="24%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="2%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="24%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="2%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="24%">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 8pt" valign="bottom">
    <TD nowrap align="center"><U>Dates</U></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD nowrap align="left"><U>Annual Rent</U></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD nowrap align="left"><U>Monthly Rent</U></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD nowrap align="left"><U>Annual Rent Per RSF</U></TD>
</TR>

<!-- End Table Head -->
<!-- Begin Table Body -->
<TR valign="bottom" style="background: #cceeff">

</DIV>


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;5.&nbsp;<U>Operating Expenses</U>. Operating Expenses for the Remaining Space shall be handled in
the same manner as those for the Additional Space, as set forth in <U>Paragraph&nbsp;6</U> of the Sixth
Amendment.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;6.&nbsp;<U>Tenant Improvements</U>. Landlord shall, as soon as reasonably practicable, at its sole
cost and expense, expand the size of the exercise facility identified in the Sixth Amendment by an
amount determined by Tenant, up to an additional 400 square feet. At Tenant&#146;s request made within
fifteen (15)&nbsp;days after the date of this Amendment, Landlord shall, at Tenant&#146;s sole cost and
expense, expand the size of such exercise facility beyond such additional 400 square feet. In
addition, Landlord shall contribute up to One Hundred Fifty-Eight Thousand Seven Hundred Eighty
Dollars ($158,780) (the &#147;<U>Landlord&#146;s Contribution</U>&#148;) toward improvements to the


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">-2-
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">



<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">Premises made by Tenant in accordance with <U>Article&nbsp;8</U> of the Lease during the period
commencing on the date of this Amendment and expiring on the expiration or sooner termination of
the Term. The Landlord&#146;s Contribution shall be made by Landlord to Tenant within ten (10)&nbsp;days
after receipt by Landlord of third-party invoices for completed work. The Landlord&#146;s Contribution
is in addition to, and not in any manner in derogation of, the tenant improvement obligations of
Landlord set forth in <U>Paragraph&nbsp;7</U> of the Sixth Amendment.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;7.&nbsp;<U>Parking Stalls</U>. In complete satisfaction of Tenant&#146;s parking rights set forth in
the Lease, commencing on the Final Expansion Date, Tenant shall be entitled to the exclusive use of
the four hundred nineteen (419)&nbsp;parking stalls in the parking lots and parking structure (upper and
lower levels) adjacent to the Building, comprising one hundred percent (100%) of all parking stalls
serving the Building. Tenant may, at its sole cost and expense, subject to reimbursement as part
of the Landlord&#146;s Contribution, install a security gate at the entrance to the lower level of such
parking structure, which may be linked to Tenant&#146;s security system, provided that Tenant first
obtains Landlord&#146;s written approval of the size, color and style of such security gate.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;8.&nbsp;<U>Options to Extend</U>. The options to extend set forth in the Sixth Amendment shall
apply to the entire Premises, comprised of the Previous Space and the Remaining Space.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;9.&nbsp;<U>Security Station</U>. Notwithstanding <U>Paragraph&nbsp;11</U> of the Sixth Amendment to the
contrary, Tenant may, at its option, leave its security station in its current location.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;10.&nbsp;<U>General Provisions</U>. In the event of any conflict between the provisions of the
Lease and the provisions of this Amendment, the provisions of this Amendment shall control. As
modified by this Amendment, the Lease and all of Tenant&#146;s obligations under the Lease are ratified
and affirmed in their entirety. This Amendment shall inure to the benefit of, and be binding on,
the Parties and their respective successors and assigns. This Amendment shall be governed by, and
construed and interpreted in accordance with, the laws (excluding the choice of laws rules) of the
state of Utah. This Amendment may be executed in one document or in any number of duplicate
originals or counterparts, each of which when so executed shall constitute in the aggregate but one
and the same document, and shall be binding after each Party has signed this Amendment and Advanta
Corp. has signed the attached Consent and Confirmation of Guarantor, and each Party has received a
fully executed copy of this Amendment and such attachment. Each individual executing this
Amendment represents and warrants that such individual has been duly authorized to execute and
deliver this Amendment in the capacity and for the entity set forth where such individual signs.
Each exhibit referred to in, and attached to, this Amendment is an integral part of this Amendment
and is incorporated in this Amendment by this reference.


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">-3-
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

effective as of the date first set forth above.

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">to



<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">SEVENTH AMENDMENT TO COMMERCIAL LEASE



<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><DIV style="border-bottom: 1px solid #000000; font-size: 1px">&nbsp;</DIV>



<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">REMAINING SPACE



<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Remaining Space referred to in the foregoing instrument is shown on the attachment.


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">-5-
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">CONSENT AND CONFIRMATION OF GUARANTOR



<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;THE UNDERSIGNED, ADVANTA CORP., a Delaware corporation, the guarantor of the Lease identified
in the foregoing Seventh Amendment to Commercial Lease, (i)&nbsp;consents to such amendment, (ii)&nbsp;agrees
that the undersigned&#146;s guaranty of the Lease is in full force and effect and will continue to apply
to the Lease, as amended by the foregoing amendment, or as otherwise amended on or after the date
of this instrument, and (iii)&nbsp;agrees that the undersigned has no defenses to the enforcement of
such guaranty, which is and shall continue to be enforceable in accordance with its terms.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;DATED: <U> January&nbsp;27</U>, 2005

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">LIMITED PARTNERSHIP AGREEMENT

    <TD><DIV style="margin-left:15px; text-indent:-15px">&nbsp;</DIV></TD>

    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">

    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
