<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">-iv-
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>
<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><B>LIMITED PARTNERSHIP AGREEMENT</B>

<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;THIS LIMITED PARTNERSHIP AGREEMENT is made as of the 26 day of May, 1998, for good and
valuable consideration, by the Initial Partners (as defined herein).


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><U>BACKGROUND</U>



<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A.&nbsp;The Initial Partners are the members of Fleet Credit Card, LLC, a limited liability company
formed under the laws of the State of Rhode Island (the &#147;LLC&#148;).


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;B.&nbsp;The Initial Partners desire to form a limited partnership under the Act for the purpose of
succeeding to the Business of, and the assets and liabilities of, the LLC upon the terms and
conditions set forth herein.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;C.&nbsp;The LLC shall be merged with and into the Company (the &#147;Merger&#148;), with the Company being
the surviving entity in such Merger.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;D.&nbsp;To effectuate the intentions of the parties, the parties now desire to set forth their
agreement with respect to the limited partnership pursuant to the terms and conditions of this
Agreement.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the foregoing and the premises set forth herein and for
other good and valuable consideration, the receipt and sufficiency of which are hereby
acknowledged, and intending to be legally bound hereby, the parties hereto agree as follows:


<P>
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left"><B>1.</B>&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><U><B>SECTION 1 &#151; DEFINITIONS</B>.</U> For the purposes of this Agreement:</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.1 <I>&#147;Act&#148; </I>means the Rhode Island Limited Partnership Act, as amended from time to time, except
that it shall not include any provision thereof adopted after the date hereof that would only be
applicable to the Company absent a provision in this Agreement to the contrary unless such
provision is approved by the General Partner.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.2 <I>&#147;Additional Capital Contributions&#148; </I>means any contributions to the capital of the Company
made by any Partner after the date hereof pursuant to Section&nbsp;3.2 or Section&nbsp;3.5, other than the
Initial Capital Contributions made by an Initial Partner pursuant to Section&nbsp;3.1.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.3 <I>&#147;Adjusted Capital Account Deficit&#148; </I>shall mean, with respect to any Partner, the deficit
balance, if any, in such Partner&#146;s Capital Account as of the end of any relevant fiscal year and
after giving effect to the following adjustments:


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;credit to such Capital Account any amounts which such Partner is obligated or treated as
obligated


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">
<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">to restore with respect to any deficit balance in such Capital Account pursuant to
Section&nbsp;1.704-1(b)(2) (ii) (<U>c</U>) of the Regulations or is deemed to be obligated to restore
with respect to any deficit balance pursuant to the penultimate sentences of Sections&nbsp;1.704-2(g)
(l)&nbsp;and 1.704-2 (i) (5)&nbsp;of the Regulations; and

<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;debit to such Capital Account the items described in Sections&nbsp;1.704-1(b)(2)
(ii)(<U>d</U>)(<U>4</U>), 1.704-1(b)(2) (ii)(<U>d</U>)(<U>5</U>) and 1.704-1(b)(2)
(ii)(<U>d</U>)(<U>6</U>) of the Regulations.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.4 <I>&#147;Advanta&#148; </I>means Advanta Corp., a Delaware corporation.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.5 <I>&#147;Advanta Credit Card Business&#148; </I>means the Business contributed by Advanta and its
Affiliates to the LLC and its Affiliates pursuant to the Contribution Agreement.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.6 <I>&#147;Advanta Partner&#148; </I>means Advanta and each Partner which is an Affiliate of Advanta or an
assignee of Interests of an Advanta Partner who becomes a Partner in accordance with the terms of
this Agreement.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.7 <I>&#147;Affiliate&#148; </I>means, as to any Person, any other Person that directly or indirectly, through
one or more intermediaries controls, is controlled by or is under common control with such Person.
As used in this definition, the term &#147;control&#148; means the possession, directly or indirectly, or as
trustee or executor, of the power to direct or cause the direction of the management and policies
of a Person, whether through ownership of voting securities, as trustee or executor, by contract or
credit arrangement or otherwise.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.8 <I>&#147;Agreement&#148; </I>means this Limited Partnership Agreement, as it may be amended, modified,
supplemented or restated from time to time.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.9 <I>&#147;Base Operating Earnings&#148; </I>means the pre-tax operating earnings of the Business (as
operated by the Company and the LLC, as the Company&#146;s predecessor) determined in accordance with
generally accepted accounting principles, consistently applied.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.10
<I>&#147;Book/Tax Differential&#148; </I>shall mean the sum of
(i)&nbsp;the difference between the financial
statement value of the Company Contributed Assets and Company Transferred Liabilities (as such
terms are defined in the Contribution Agreement) as provided on the Closing Balance Sheet delivered
to the LLC pursuant to the Contribution Agreement and the federal income tax adjusted basis of such
assets and liabilities as of the Closing Date (as provided on Schedule&nbsp;3.1 attached to the Limited
Liability Agreement of the LLC) and (ii)&nbsp;the $44,261,000 of insurance deferred acquisition costs;
<I>provided, however, </I>that the Book/Tax Differential shall be adjusted as appropriate, to take into
account adjustment to the income tax basis of the Company Contributed Assets or Company Transferred
Liabilities determined as of the Closing Date to the extent of adjustments by the Internal Revenue
Service.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.11 <I>&#147;Business&#148; </I>means the operation of a credit card lending business, including, without
limitation, the origination and servicing of consumer credit cards, the determination of
creditworthiness of consumer credit card account customers, the extension of credit to consumer
credit card account customers and the maintenance of consumer credit
card accounts and


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">-2-
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">collection
of receivables with respect thereto, anywhere in the world, and to do any and all things necessary
to, convenient or, incidental to that purpose.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.12 <I>&#147;Capital Account&#148; </I>shall mean, with respect to any Partner, the capital account
established and maintained pursuant to Section&nbsp;3.3.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.13 <I>&#147;Capital Contribution&#148; </I>shall mean, with respect to any Partner, the aggregate amount of
money, and the initial Gross Asset Value of any property or asset contributed or deemed contributed
to the Company, net of liabilities assumed by the Company in connection with such contribution or
as to which such property or asset is subject when contributed, as
set forth on Schedule&nbsp;A hereto.
In the case of a Partner that acquires an Interest in the Company by virtue of an assignment or
transfer in accordance with the terms of this Agreement, &#147;Capital Contribution&#148; means the Capital
Contribution of such Partner&#146;s predecessor to the extent relating to the acquired Interest.



<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.14 <I>&#147;Closing Date&#148; </I>shall mean February&nbsp;20, 1998, the date the Limited Liability Company
Agreement for the LLC was signed.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.15 <I>&#147;Company&#148; </I>means Fleet Credit Card Services, L.P., a Rhode Island limited partnership.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.16 <I>&#147;Company Minimum </I>Gain&#148; shall have the meaning set forth in Section&nbsp;1.704-2(b)(2) of the
Regulations.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.17 <I>&#147;Contribution Agreement&#148; </I>means the Contribution Agreement, dated as of October&nbsp;28, 1997,
by and between Advanta and Fleet.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.18 <I>&#147;Covered Person&#148; </I>means a Partner, any Affiliate of a Partner, any officers, directors,
shareholders, partners or partners of a Partner or its respective Affiliates or any officers of the
Company.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.19 <I>&#147;Depreciation&#148; </I>shall mean, with respect to any asset of the Company for any fiscal year
or other period, an amount equal to the depreciation, amortization or other cost recovery, as the
case may be, allowed or allowable for federal income tax purposes in respect of such asset for such
fiscal year or other period; <I>provided, however, </I>that if there is a difference between the Gross
Asset Value and the adjusted tax basis of such asset, Depreciation shall mean &#147;book&#148; depreciation,
cost recovery or amortization as determined under Section&nbsp;1.704-1(b)(2)(iv)(g)(<U>3</U>) of the
Regulations.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.20 <I>&#147;Distributable Cash </I>Flow&#148; means the amount of cash available for distribution by the
Company as determined by the General Partner in its sole and absolute discretion.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.21 <I>&#147;Fleet&#148; </I>means Fleet Financial Group, Inc., a Rhode Island corporation.


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">-3-
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.22 <I>&#147;Fleet Partner&#148; </I>means Fleet and each Partner which is an Affiliate of Fleet or any
assignee of Interests of a Fleet Partner who becomes a Partner in accordance with the terms of this
Agreement.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.23 <I>&#147;General Partner&#148; </I>shall initially mean Fleet Credit Card Holdings, Inc., a Delaware
corporation, and shall include any other Person that becomes a general partner of the Company.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.24 <I>&#147;Gross Asset Value&#148; </I>shall mean, with respect to any asset of the Company, such asset&#146;s
adjusted basis for federal income tax purposes, except as follows:


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;the initial Gross Asset Value of any asset (other than cash) contributed or deemed
contributed to the Company shall be (i)&nbsp;in the case of any asset transferred to the Company by
operation of law as a result of the Merger, the gross asset value assigned to such asset by the LLC
immediately prior to the Merger and (ii)&nbsp;in the case of any other asset hereafter contributed by a
Partner, the gross fair market value of such asset at the time of its contribution as reasonably
determined by the General Partner;



<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;if the General Partner reasonably determines that an adjustment is necessary or
appropriate to reflect the relative economic interests of the Partners, the Gross Asset Values of
all Company assets shall be adjusted to equal their respective gross fair market values, as
reasonably determined by the General Partner, as of the following times:


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(i)&nbsp;immediately prior to a Capital Contribution (other than <I>a de minimis </I>Capital Contribution)
to the Company by a new or existing Partner as consideration for a Company Interest;


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(ii)&nbsp;immediately prior to the distribution by the Company to a Partner of more than a <I>de
minimis </I>amount of Company property as consideration for the redemption of a Company Interest; and


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(iii)&nbsp;immediately prior to the liquidation of the Company within the meaning of Section
1.704-1(b)(2)(ii)(g) of the Regulations;


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(c)&nbsp;the Gross Asset Values of Company assets distributed to any Partner shall be the gross
fair market values of such assets as reasonably determined by the General Partner as of the date of
distribution; and

<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(d)&nbsp;the Gross Asset Value of any Company asset shall be increased (or decreased) to reflect
any adjustments to the adjusted basis of such asset pursuant to Sections 734(b) or 743(b) of the
Code, but only to the extent that such adjustment is taken into account in determining Capital
Accounts pursuant to Section&nbsp;1.704-1(b)(2)(iv)(<U>m</U>) of the Regulations; <I>provided, however,</I>
that the Gross Asset Value shall not be adjusted pursuant to

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">-4-
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">this paragraph to the extent that the
General Partner reasonably determines that an adjustment pursuant to paragraph (b)&nbsp;above is
necessary or appropriate in connection with a transaction that would otherwise result in an
adjustment pursuant to this paragraph (d).


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;At all times, the Gross Asset Value of an asset shall be adjusted by any Depreciation taken
into account with respect to such asset for purposes of computing Net Income and Net Loss. Any
adjustment to the Gross Asset Values of Company property shall require an adjustment to the
Partners&#146; Capital Accounts.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.25 <I>&#147;Initial Capital Contribution&#148; </I>means (i)&nbsp;as to each Partner executing this Agreement as
of the Closing Date, the amount specified for that Partner as its Initial Capital Contribution
(which amount shall equal the value of the interest in the LLC owned by such Partner at the time of
the Merger), and (ii)&nbsp;in the case of new Partners admitted pursuant to Section&nbsp;3.4, the Initial
Capital Contribution established pursuant thereto.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.26 <I>&#147;Initial Partner&#148; </I>means any Person executing this Agreement as of the Closing Date as a
Partner, such Initial Partners consisting of all of the members of the LLC.



<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.27 <I>&#147;Interest&#148; </I>means a Partner&#146;s share of the capital, Net Income and Net Loss of, and the
right to receive distributions from the Company.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.28 <I>&#147;Internal Revenue Code&#148; </I>or <I>&#147;Code&#148; </I>means the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended, or
any successor statute. All references to specific sections of the Internal Revenue Code shall be
deemed to include any provisions of the Internal Revenue Code which replaces or supersedes the
sections in effect at the time of execution of this Agreement.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.29 <I>&#147;Involuntary Withdrawal&#148; </I>means, with respect to any Partner, (i)&nbsp;the death, resignation,
expulsion, bankruptcy or dissolution of such Partner as such events are construed in accordance
with Section&nbsp;7-13-23 of the Act or (ii)&nbsp;the obligatory withdrawal of such Partner caused by such
Partner&#146;s attempted Transfer of its Partnership Rights, collateral assignment, mortgage, pledge,
lien encumbrance or placing of any other charge in violation of this Agreement. In the event of
the Involuntary Withdrawal of a General Partner, its Interest shall be converted automatically to
an Interest as a Limited Partner.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.30 <I>&#147;LLC&#148; </I>means Fleet Credit Card, LLC, a limited liability company formed under the laws of
the State of Rhode Island.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.31 <I>&#147;Limited Partner&#148; </I>means any Person executing this Agreement as of the Closing Date as a
limited partner as set forth on Schedule&nbsp;A and any Person who subsequently is admitted as a limited
partner of the Company, in accordance herewith, but does not include any Person who has ceased to
be a Limited Partner of the Company.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.32 <I>&#147;Merger&#148; </I>shall mean the merger of the LLC with and into the Company, with the Company
being the entity surviving the merger.



<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">-5-
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<Div style="font-family: 'times new roman',times,serif">


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.33 <I>&#147;Net Gains from Sales&#148; </I>means the first $10&nbsp;million of Net Income recognized by the
Company from the sale or other disposition of all or substantially all of the Company&#146;s assets
(other than in the ordinary course of its business) in excess of the cumulative sum of the
Depreciation (accrued through the date of such disposition and after the Closing Date) attributable
to the Company&#146;s assets.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.34 <I>&#147;Net Income&#148; </I>or <I>&#147;Net Loss&#148; </I>shall mean, for each fiscal year or other applicable period,
an amount equal to the Company&#146;s net income or loss for such year or period as determined for
federal income tax purposes by the Company&#146;s accountants, determined in accordance with Section
703(a) of the Code (for this purpose all items of income, gain, loss or deduction required to be
stated separately pursuant to Section&nbsp;703(a)(1) of the Code shall be included in taxable income or
loss), with the following adjustments: (a)&nbsp;by including as an item of income any tax-exempt income
received by the Company; (b)&nbsp;by treating as a deductible expense any expenditure of the Company
described in Section&nbsp;705(a)(2)(B) of the Code (including amounts paid or incurred to organize the
Company (unless an election is made pursuant to Section 709(b) of the Code) or to promote the sale
of Interests and by treating deductions for any losses incurred in connection with the sale or
exchange of Company property disallowed pursuant to Section&nbsp;267(a)(1) or Section 707(b) of the Code
as expenditures
described in Section&nbsp;705(a)(2)(B) of the Code); (c)&nbsp;in lieu of depreciation, depletion,
amortization, and other cost recovery deductions taken into account
in computing total income or loss, there shall be taken into account Depreciation; (d)&nbsp;gain or loss resulting from any
disposition of Company property with respect to which gain or loss is recognized for federal income
tax purposes shall be computed by reference to the Gross Asset Value of such property rather than
its adjusted tax basis; and (e)&nbsp;in the event of an adjustment of the Gross Asset Value of any
Company asset, which requires that the Capital Accounts of the Company be adjusted pursuant to
Regulation&nbsp;Section&nbsp;1.704-1(b)(2)(iv)(<U>e</U>), (<U>f</U>) and (<U>m</U>), the amount of such
adjustment is to be taken into account as additional Net Income or Net Loss pursuant to Section
4.3. If an item of income, gain, loss or deduction has been allocated pursuant to the special
allocation rules in Section&nbsp;4.3.3, Section&nbsp;4.4 or Section&nbsp;4.6, Net Income or Net Loss shall be
computed without regard to such item.



<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.35 <I>&#147;Non-Public Information&#148; </I>means information not in the public domain that is provided to a
Partner in its capacity as a party to any Transaction Document.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.36
<I>&#147;Nonrecourse Deductions&#148; </I>shall have the meaning set forth in Sections&nbsp;1.704-2(b)(1) and
(c)&nbsp;of the Regulations.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.37 <I>&#147;Nonrecourse Liabilities&#148; </I>shall have the meaning set forth in Section&nbsp;1.704-2(b)(3) of
the Regulations.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.38 <I>&#147;Partner&#148; </I>shall mean a General Partner or a Limited Partner of the Company.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.39 <I>&#147;Partner Nonrecourse Deductions&#148; </I>shall have the meaning set forth in Section
1.704-2(i)(2) of the Regulations.

</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>
<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.40 <I>&#147;Partnership Rights&#148; </I>means all of the rights of a Partner of the Company, including,
without limitation, a Partner&#146;s (i)&nbsp;Interest; (ii)&nbsp;right to inspect the Company&#146;s books and
records; and (iii)&nbsp;right to participate in the management of and vote on matters coming before the
Company in accordance with this Agreement.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.41 <I>&#147;Partner Nonrecourse Debt Minimum Gain&#148; </I>shall have the meaning set forth in Section
1.704-2(i)(2) of the Regulations.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.42 <I>&#147;Percentage&#148; </I>means, as to a Partner, its percentage Interest set forth after the
Partner&#146;s name on Schedule&nbsp;A, as amended from time to time.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.43 <I>&#147;Person&#148; </I>means and includes an individual and any other entity including, but not limited
to, a corporation, partnership, association, limited liability company, joint stock company, trust
or estate.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.44 <I>&#147;Preferred Capital Contribution Amount&#148; </I>means the amount contributed to the capital of
the Company by the Fleet Partners and designated by the General Partner as a preferred capital
contribution having such rights, designations, preferences, qualifications, privileges, limitations
and restrictions as shall be fixed from time to time by the General Partner.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.45 <I>&#147;Preferred Return&#148; </I>means a distribution computed with respect to the amount of the
Preferred Capital Contribution Amount at such annual rate fixed by the General Partner at the time
of the contribution of the Preferred Capital Contribution Amount to the Company.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.46 <I>&#147;Rhode Island Secretary of State&#148; </I>means the Secretary of State of the State of Rhode
Island.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.47 <I>&#147;Regulations&#148; </I>or <I>&#147;Treasury Regulations&#148; </I>shall mean the income tax regulations, including
temporary regulations, promulgated under the Code, as such regulations may be amended from time to
time. All references to specific sections of the Regulations shall be deemed to include any
provisions of the Regulations which replace or supersede the sections in effect at the Closing
Date.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.48 <I>&#147;Subsidiary&#148; </I>means, when used with reference to an entity, any corporation or other
entity, a majority of the outstanding voting securities of which are owned directly or indirectly
by such entity.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.49 <I>&#147;Tax&#148; </I>or <I>&#147;Taxes&#148; </I>means any and all federal, state, county, provincial, local, foreign and
other taxes, charges, fees, levies or other assessments, including, without limitation, all net
income, gross income, gross receipts, premium, estimated, capital, sales, use, <I>ad valorem</I>,
property, transfer, franchise, profits, license, withholding, payroll, employment, excise,
severance, stamp, occupation, customs, duties or guaranty fund assessments, together with any
interest, additions to tax or interest, and penalties with respect thereto imposed by any taxing or
governmental authority.

<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.50 <I>&#147;Transaction Documents&#148; </I>mean the Contribution Agreement and all other ancillary
agreements to be executed by Advanta and Fleet or their respective Affiliates in connection with
the transactions contemplated by the Contribution Agreement.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.51 <I>&#147;Transfer&#148; </I>means, when used as a noun, any voluntary sale, exchange, disposition,
assignment, or other transfer, and, when used as a verb, means voluntarily to sell, exchange,
dispose of, assign or otherwise transfer. Transfer does not include collateral assignment,
mortgage, pledge, lien, encumbrance or the placing of any charge or security interest.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.52 <I>&#147;US Dollars&#148; </I>or <I>&#147;US$&#148; </I>means the lawful currency of the United States of America.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.53 <I>&#147;Voluntary Withdrawal&#148; </I>means a Partner&#146;s dissociation from the Company by means other
than a Transfer of a Partner&#146;s Partnership Rights or an Involuntary Withdrawal.

noted below:

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">-&nbsp;8&nbsp;-
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt"><B>2. </B><U><B>SECTION 2 &#151; FORMATION OF THE COMPANY</B></U>



<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.1 <U>Formation</U>. (i)&nbsp;The Initial Partners hereby confirm the formation of the Company
as a limited partnership under and pursuant to the Act and all other pertinent laws of the State of
Rhode Island on May &#95;&#95;&#95;,1998 by the filing of the Certificate of Limited Partnership, in the form
attached hereto as <U>Exhibit&nbsp;A</U>, in the office of the Rhode Island Secretary of State. From
and after the date hereof, this Agreement shall serve as the Limited Partnership Agreement of the
Company. The parties hereto agree that the rights, duties and liabilities of the Initial Partners
and any additional Partner admitted to the Company in accordance with the terms hereof, shall be as
provided in the Act, except as otherwise provided herein.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(ii)&nbsp;CT Corporation is hereby designated as an authorized person, within the meaning of the
Act, to execute, deliver and file, or to cause the execution, delivery and filing of, any
amendments or restatements of the Certificate of Limited Partnership, any other certificates,
notices, statements or other instruments (and any amendments or restatements thereof) necessary or
advisable for the continuation of the Company or the operation of the Company in all jurisdictions
where the Company may elect to do business, but no such amendment or restatement may be executed,
delivered or filed unless adopted in a manner authorized by this Agreement.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.2 <U>Name of the Company</U>. The name of the Company is Fleet Credit Card Services, L.P.
The Company shall do business under that name and under any other name or names upon which Fleet,
or any Fleet Partner designated by Fleet, shall determine, in its sole discretion. Each of the
Partners agrees to take any and all actions as may be required by law to have the LLC consent, in writing, to
allow the Company to use such name as required by Section&nbsp;7-13-2(3) of the Act. If the Company
does business under a name other than Fleet Credit Card Services, L.P., then the Company shall file
a trade name certificate as required by law. Each Partner hereby agrees to take any and all action
as may be required to amend the Certificate of Limited Partnership to reflect any change in the
name of the Company.

<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.3 <U>Purpose</U>. The Company is organized to engage in the Business. The Company may
also engage in and carry on any lawful business, purpose or activity for which limited partnerships
may be formed under the Act and shall possess and exercise all the powers and privileges granted to
it by the Act, by any other law or by this Agreement, together with any powers incidental to the
conduct, promotion and attainment of the business, purpose or activities of the Company, so far as
such powers are necessary or convenient; <I>provided, however</I><B><I>, </I></B>that the Company shall not engage in
any activity other than activities that are part of, or incidental to, the business of banking and
are permissible for an operating subsidiary of a national bank.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.4 <U>Term</U>. The term of the Company shall begin on the date of acceptance of the
Certificate of Limited Partnership by the office of the Rhode Island Secretary of State and shall
continue until December&nbsp;31, 2027 (the &#147;Initial Term&#148;), subject to consecutive successive one (1)
year extensions (each, an &#147;Extension&#148;) unless (a)&nbsp;its existence is sooner terminated pursuant to
Section&nbsp;8 of this Agreement or (b)&nbsp;at least 180&nbsp;days prior to the end of the Initial Term or any
Extension then in effect a Partner shall notify all other Partners of such Partner&#146;s refusal to


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">-&nbsp;9&nbsp;-
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">extend, in which case the term shall continue until the end of such Initial Term or Extension, as
applicable. The existence of the Company as a separate legal entity shall continue until
dissolution of the Company in the manner required by the Act.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.5 <U>Principal Office</U>. The principal office of the Company shall be located at 50
Kennedy Plaza, Providence, Rhode Island 02903 or at any other place which the General Partner may
determine.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.6 <U>Registered Agent</U>. The name and address of the Company&#146;s registered agent and
office in the State of Rhode island shall be Edwards &#038; Angell, 2700 Hospital Trust Tower,
Providence, Rhode Island 02903. At any time, the Chief Executive Officer may designate another
registered agent and/or registered office.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.7 <U>Partners</U>. The name, present mailing address, Initial Capital Contribution and
Percentage of each Partner are set forth on Schedule&nbsp;A. The Chief Executive Officer, if any, or a
designee of the Chief Executive Officer, shall be authorized and required to update from time to
time as necessary to accurately reflect the information therein as known by the Chief Executive
Officer, but no such update shall modify Schedule&nbsp;A in any manner inconsistent with this Agreement or
the Act. Any amendment or revision to Schedule&nbsp;A made in accordance with this Agreement shall not
be deemed an amendment to this Agreement for purposes of Section&nbsp;10.12. Any reference in this
Agreement to Schedule&nbsp;A shall be deemed to be a reference to Schedule&nbsp;A, as amended and in effect
from time to time.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.8 <U>Scope of Authority</U>. No Limited Partner shall have any authority to bind or act
for, or assume any obligations or responsibility on behalf of, any other Partner or the Company,
and neither the Company nor any Partner shall be responsible or liable for any indebtedness or
obligation of any other Partner or otherwise relating to the Company incurred or arising either
before or after the execution of this Agreement, except as to those liabilities and obligations
assumed by the Company pursuant to the terms of the Contribution Agreement, and the other
Transaction Documents and those joint responsibilities, liabilities or obligations incurred after
the date hereof pursuant to and as limited by the terms of this Agreement.

<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.9 <U>Opening Balance Sheet; Tax Consequences of the Merger</U>. The Initial Partners
acknowledge that the Company&#146;s opening balance sheet as of the Closing Date will be the same as the
closing balance sheet of the LLC on the date of the Merger. The Initial Partners acknowledge that,
for federal income tax purposes, the Company is treated as a continuation of the LLC under Section
708 of the Code and that the Merger has no effect on the adjusted income tax basis, Gross Asset
Value or other tax attributes of any assets or liabilities of the Company. The federal, state and
local income tax and other tax returns of the Company will be prepared in a manner consistent with
the foregoing, except to the extent required by applicable law or regulation.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.10 <U>Company Property</U>. All property of the Company, whether real, personal or mixed,
tangible or intangible, shall be deemed to be owned by the Company as an entity, and no Partner,
individually, shall have any direct ownership interest in such property.




<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">-&nbsp;10&nbsp;-
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt"><B>3. </B><U><B>SECTION 3 &#151; PARTNERS; CAPITAL; CAPITAL ACCOUNTS</B></U>



<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3.1 <U>Initial Capital Contributions of Initial Partners</U>. At the time of the Merger,
each of the Initial Partners shall be deemed to have made a capital contribution to the Company
equal to the fair market value of its interest in the LLC. The Gross Asset Value to the Company
and the federal income tax adjusted basis of such Initial Capital Contributions will be as set
forth on Schedule&nbsp;B attached hereto.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3.2 <U>Additional Capital Contributions</U>.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3.2.1 Each Partner may, upon request of the General Partner, elect to contribute to the
Company, in cash or other property, as determined by the General Partner, all amounts that, in the
judgment of the General Partner, are necessary to enable the Company to cause the assets of the Company to be properly operated and maintained and to discharge its costs,
expenses, obligations and liabilities; <I>provided, however, </I>that no Advanta Partner shall be required
to make any Additional Capital Contributions; <I>provided, further, however, </I>that no Fleet Partner
will, be able to make an Additional Capital Contribution if such contribution would violate the
provisions of Section&nbsp;5.7.1. The General Partner shall notify such Partner or Partners as the
General Partner, in its sole discretion, elects of the need for voluntary Additional Capital
Contributions when appropriate.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3.2.2 Each Additional Capital Contribution made by a Partner shall cause an increase in such
Partner&#146;s Capital Account and an adjustment to such Partner&#146;s and each other Partner&#146;s Percentage;
<I>provided, however, </I>that the aggregate Percentage of all Advanta Partners shall be no less than one
percent (1 %) throughout the entire term of this Agreement.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3.2.3 Except as provided in this Agreement, a Partner shall not be entitled to a withdrawal or
a return of any part of its Capital Contributions, interest on its Capital Contributions or to
receive property or assets other than cash in return thereof.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3.2.4 Except as otherwise provided in this Agreement, no Partner shall be entitled to priority
over any other Partner with respect to a return of its Capital Contributions, to the property and
assets of the Company or to allocations of income, gains, losses, deductions, expenses,
obligations, liabilities, credits or distributions.

<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3.2.5 No Partner with a deficit balance in its Capital Account shall have any obligation to
the Company, to any other Partner or to any third party to restore the deficit balance, except as
expressly provided herein and except to the extent required by the Act.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3.3 <U>Capital Accounts</U>. The Company will maintain a capital account (the &#147;Capital
Account&#148;) for each Partner. The initial value of the Capital Account of each Initial Partner shall
be equal to its Initial Capital Contribution. Each Partner&#146;s Capital Account shall be (i)
increased by (A)&nbsp;any Additional Capital Contributions made by such Partner, (B)&nbsp;the share of
Company Net Income allocated to such Partner and any income allocated pursuant to Section&nbsp;4.3.3,
4.4,

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">-&nbsp;11&nbsp;-
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">and Section&nbsp;4.6 and (C)&nbsp;the amount of liabilities of the Company assumed by such Partner or
that are secured by any Company assets distributed to such Partner and (ii)&nbsp;decreased by (A)&nbsp;the
amount of cash and the Gross Asset Value of any Company assets distributed to such Partner, (B)&nbsp;the
share of Company Net Loss allocated to such Partner and (C)&nbsp;the amount of liabilities of the
Partner assumed by the Company or that are secured by any assets contributed to the Company by such
Partner. In the event that an Interest is transferred in accordance with this Agreement, the
Capital Account of the transferor (at the time of such transfer) shall carry over to the
transferee; <I>provided, however, </I>that if any Partner transfers less than its entire Interest in the
Company, the transferor&#146;s Capital Account shall be allocated <I>pro rata </I>to the Interest retained by
the transferor and the Interest transferred. In furtherance of the foregoing, the Capital Accounts
shall be maintained in compliance with Section&nbsp;1.704-1(b)(2)(iv) of the Regulations, and the
provisions hereof shall be interpreted and applied in a manner consistent therewith.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3.4
<U>Additional Partners</U>. Additional Persons may be admitted to the Company as Partners and Partnership Rights may be
created and issued to those Persons and to existing Partners upon the approval of the General
Partner and on such terms and conditions as the General Partner may determine at the time of
admission. The terms of admission or issuance must specify the Percentage, the amount of such
Partner&#146;s Initial Capital Contribution and any priority applicable thereto. At the time of
admission, each new Partner shall agree in writing to be bound by the terms of this Agreement and
shall make the applicable representations and warranties contained in the Contribution Agreement.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3.5 <U>Preferred Capital</U>. Additional Capital Contributions may be made in the form of
Preferred Capital Contribution Amounts having such rights, designations, preferences,
qualifications, privileges, limitations and restrictions as shall be fixed from time to time by the
General Partner.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt"><B>4. </B><U><B>SECTION 4 &#151; PROFIT, LOSS AND DISTRIBUTIONS</B></U>



<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.1 <U>Distributions of Distributable Cash Flow- Tax Withholding</U>.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.1.1
Distributable Cash Flow may be distributed from time to time in the discretion of the
General Partner in proportion to the Partners&#146; Percentages.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.1.2 The Company shall pay to the Fleet Partners, in the aggregate, at least annually, a
distribution equal to the amount of the Preferred Return.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.1.3 Notwithstanding any other provision of this Agreement, the Company shall withhold and
deposit, as required under applicable law, all withholding taxes
imposed with respect to allocation of Net Income (or items thereof) or distributions made to the Partners. Such amounts shall be
treated as a distribution to such Partner for all purposes of this Agreement. To the extent that
the amount treated as a distribution pursuant to this Section&nbsp;4.1.3 exceeds the amount which would
otherwise be distributed to such Partner under all of the provisions of Section&nbsp;4.1 for the entire
fiscal year, such excess shall be treated as a loan from the Company
to

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">-&nbsp;12&nbsp;-
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>
<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">the Partner (a &#147;Tax Loan&#148;)
which shall be repaid within thirty days after the close of the fiscal year.



<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.1.4 Notwithstanding any other provision of Section&nbsp;4.1, with respect to any fiscal quarter
of the Company in which a Partner would be allocated taxable income for federal, state and local
income tax purposes if such fiscal quarter were a separate taxable year (and for this purpose all
items of income, gain, loss or deduction required to be separately stated pursuant to Section&nbsp;703
of the Code shall be included in this calculation of taxable income (other than the amount, if any,
by which capital losses exceed capital gains)) the Company shall distribute to each such Partner,
within 10&nbsp;days after the close of such fiscal quarter, the amount determined by multiplying the
Partner&#146;s share of the Company&#146;s taxable income (computed as set forth in this sentence) by the
highest composite federal, state and local income tax rate applicable to all of the Partners (the
&#147;Tax Distribution Amount&#148;); <I>provided, however, </I>that with respect to the fourth quarter of each
fiscal year of the Company the distribution shall be made 20&nbsp;days prior to the close of the fiscal
quarter based on an estimate of the taxable income, if any, for such quarter; and <I>provided,
further, </I>that within 120&nbsp;days after the close of the fiscal year, a final calculation of such Partner&#146;s share of the taxable income of the Company for its entire fiscal year shall be
made and if the sum of the Tax Distribution Amounts to such Partner made for each fiscal quarter
differs from the Tax Distribution Amount calculated based on such final determination of the entire
fiscal year&#146;s taxable income, the difference shall be distributed to the Partner or paid by such
Partner to the Company, as the case may be. If there is a subsequent increase in a Partner&#146;s share
of taxable income for any fiscal period (as a result, for example, of an audit by a governmental
unit), the Company shall distribute an amount to such Partner sufficient for such Partner to make
any payment of Taxes, interest, penalties, or additions to Tax, actually due and owing, by reason
of such increase in a Partner&#146;s share of the Company&#146;s taxable income; <I>provided, however, </I>that no
increase in the amount of the Tax Distribution shall be made as a result of an increase in Tax
arising out of the transactions effected by the Contribution Agreement. It is further understood
by the Partners that the Tax Distribution made pursuant to this Section&nbsp;4.1.4 is being made in lieu
of the distribution of the income or gain from which such Tax arises. Accordingly, to the extent
that a distribution of income or gain is made to any Partner pursuant to any other provision of
Section&nbsp;4.1, the amount of such distribution or the amount of this Tax Distribution, as the case
may be, shall be decreased to take into account the fact that the Partner has received the income
or gain which gives rise to the Tax.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.2 <U>In-Kind Distributions</U>. Except as otherwise provided in this Agreement, assets of
the Company (other than cash) may be distributed in kind. If any assets of the Company are
distributed to the Partners in kind, such assets shall be valued on the basis of the fair market
value thereof on the date of distribution, and the Capital Accounts of the Partners shall be
adjusted to reflect the manner in which the unrealized income, gain, loss, and deduction inherent
in such property (that has not previously been reflected in the Capital Accounts of the Partners)
would be allocated among the Partners if there were a taxable disposition of such property for its
fair market value (taking into account Section&nbsp;7701 (g)&nbsp;of the Code) on the date of distribution.


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">-&nbsp;13&nbsp;-
</DIV>
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.3 <U>Allocation of Net Income and Net Loss</U>.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.3.1 <U>Net Income</U>. After giving effect to the special allocations set forth in Section
4.4, Section&nbsp;4.3.3 and Section&nbsp;4.6, Net Income for any fiscal year or other applicable period shall
be allocated as set forth in this Section&nbsp;4.3.1:


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(i)&nbsp;First, to the Fleet Partners until the cumulative Net Income allocated pursuant to this
Section&nbsp;4.3.1 (i)&nbsp;for the current and all prior periods equals the cumulative Net Loss allocated
pursuant Section&nbsp;4.3.2(ii) to such Partners;


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(ii)&nbsp;Second, to the Partners, until the cumulative Net Income allocated pursuant to this
Section&nbsp;4.3.1(ii) for the current and all prior periods equals the cumulative Net Loss allocated to
such Partners pursuant to Sections&nbsp;4.3.2 (i)&nbsp;and (iii)&nbsp;hereof for all prior periods among the
Partners in the reverse order that such Net Loss was allocated pursuant to Sections&nbsp;4.3.2(i) and
(iii)&nbsp;hereof;


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(iii)&nbsp;Third, to the Partners, in proportion to their respective Percentages, until the
cumulative sum allocated under Section&nbsp;4.3.1 (i)&nbsp;and
(ii)&nbsp;hereof and this Section&nbsp;4.3.1 (iii)&nbsp;results in a positive Capital Account balance for each Partner equal to
the aggregate of such Partner&#146;s Capital Contributions, including such Partners Initial Capital
Contributions, Preferred Capital Contribution Amount and Additional Capital Contributions (without
taking into account in determining Capital Account balances an amount equal to (x)&nbsp;any income or
gain allocated to a Partner under Sections&nbsp;4.6 and 4.3.1(iv) hereof, minus (y)&nbsp;the sum of
distributions under Sections&nbsp;4.1.1, 4.1.3 and 4.1.4 hereof to such Partner, but only up to an
amount of distributions that does not exceed the amount determined under clause (x)); and,


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(iv)&nbsp;Fourth, to the Partners in proportion to their respective Percentages.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.3.2 <U>Net Loss</U>. After giving effect to the special allocations set forth in Section
4.4, Section&nbsp;4.3.3 and Section&nbsp;4.6, Net Loss of the Company for each fiscal year or other
applicable period shall be allocated as follows:


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(i)&nbsp;To the Partners in proportion to their respective Percentages, until the amount of the
Capital Account balance of each Fleet Partner is equal to the amount of its Preferred Capital
Contribution Amount and the amount of the Capital Account balance of each Advanta Partner is equal
to $0.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(ii)&nbsp;To the Fleet Partners, to the extent of and in proportion to, the remaining positive
balance in their respective Capital Accounts; and


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(iii)&nbsp;Thereafter, to the Partners in proportion to their respective Percentages.




<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">-&nbsp;14&nbsp;-
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(iv)&nbsp;Notwithstanding Section&nbsp;4.3.2(i)-(iii) hereof, to the extent any Net Loss allocated to a
Partner under Section&nbsp;4.3.2(i)-(iii) would cause such Partner to have an Adjusted Capital Account
Deficit as of the end of the fiscal year to which such Net Loss relates, such Net Loss shall not be
allocated to such Partner and instead shall be allocated to other Partners (herein the &#147;Permitted Partners&#148;), if any, having positive Capital Account balances, in proportion to such balances, and
thereafter in accordance with the Permitted Partners&#146; respective economic risk of loss with respect
to any indebtedness to which the remaining Net Loss (or any item thereof) is attributable.



<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.3.3 For each fiscal year or other applicable period of the Company, gross income of the
Company shall be allocated to the Fleet Partners to the extent of the excess of the cumulative
Preferred Return paid to the Fleet Partners for all periods over the cumulative amount of gross
income previously allocated to the Fleet Partners pursuant to this Section&nbsp;4.3.3.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.4 <U>Special Allocations</U>. The following special allocations shall be made in the
following order:


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.4.1 <U>Minimum Gain Chargeback</U>. If there is a net decrease in Company Minimum Gain for
any Company fiscal year (except as a result of conversion or refinancing of Company indebtedness,
certain capital contributions or revaluation of the Company property as further outlined in
Sections&nbsp;1.704-2(d)(4), (f)(2) or (f)(3) of the Regulations), each Partner shall be specially allocated items of Company income and gain for such year (and, if necessary,
subsequent years) in an amount equal to that Partner&#146;s share of the net decrease in Company Minimum
Gain. The items to be so allocated shall be determined in accordance with Section&nbsp;1.704-2(f) of
the Regulations. This Section&nbsp;4.4.1 is intended to comply with the minimum gain chargeback
requirement in said Section of the Regulations and shall be interpreted consistently therewith.
Allocations pursuant to this Section&nbsp;4.4.1 shall be made in proportion to the respective amounts
required to be allocated to each Partner pursuant hereto.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.4.2 <U>Minimum Gain Attributable to Partner Nonrecourse Debt</U>. If there is a net
decrease in Partner Nonrecourse Debt Minimum Gain during any fiscal year (other than due to the
conversion, refinancing or other change in the debt instrument causing it to become partially or
wholly nonrecourse, certain capital contributions, or certain
revaluations of Company property (as
further outlined in Section&nbsp;1.704-2(i)(4)of the Regulations), each Partner shall be specially
allocated items of Company income and gain for such year (and, if necessary, subsequent years) in
an amount equal to the Partner&#146;s share of the net decrease in the Partner Nonrecourse Debt Minimum
Gain. The items to be so allocated shall be determined in accordance with Section&nbsp;1.704-2(i)(4)
and (j)(2)of the Regulations. This paragraph 4.4.2 is intended to comply with the minimum gain
chargeback requirement with respect to Partner Nonrecourse Debt contained in said section of the
Regulations and shall be interpreted consistently therewith. Allocations pursuant to this Section
4.4.2 shall be made in proportion to the respective amounts required to be allocated to each
Partner pursuant hereto.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.4.3 <U>Qualified Income Offset</U>. In the event a Partner unexpectedly receives any
adjustments, allocations or distributions described in Section&nbsp;1.704-1(b)(2)(ii)(d)(4), (5), or (6)
of


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">-&nbsp;15&nbsp;-
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">the Regulations, and such Partner has an Adjusted Capital Account Deficit, items of Company
income and gain shall be specially allocated to such Partner in an amount and manner sufficient to
eliminate the Adjusted Capital Account Deficit as quickly as possible. This paragraph 4.4.3 is
intended to constitute a &#147;qualified income offset&#148; under Section&nbsp;1.704-1(b)(2)(ii)(d) of the
Regulations and shall be interpreted consistently therewith.

<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.4.4 <U>Nonrecourse Deductions</U>. Nonrecourse Deductions for any fiscal year or other
applicable period shall be allocated to the Partners in accordance with their respective
Percentages.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.4.5 <U>Partner Nonrecourse Deductions</U>. Partner Nonrecourse Deductions for any fiscal
year or other applicable period shall be specially allocated to the Partner that bears the economic
risk of loss for the debt in respect of which such Partner Nonrecourse Deductions are attributable
(as determined under Section&nbsp;1.704-2(b)(4) and (i)(1) of the Regulations).


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.4.6 <U>Curative Allocations</U>. The Regulatory Allocations shall be taken into account in
allocating other items of income, gain, loss, and deduction among the Partners so that, to the
extent possible, the cumulative net amount of allocations of Company items under Sections&nbsp;4.3 and
4.4 shall be equal to the net amount that would have been allocated to each Partner if the
Regulatory Allocations had not occurred. This Section&nbsp;4.4.6 is intended to minimize to the extent
possible and to the extent necessary any economic distortions which may result from application of
the Regulatory Allocations and shall be interpreted in a manner consistent therewith. For purposes hereof, &#147;Regulatory Allocations&#148; shall mean the
allocations provided under this Section&nbsp;4.4 (other than this Section&nbsp;4.4.6.)


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.5 <U>Tax Allocations</U>.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.5.1 <U>Generally</U>. Subject to Section&nbsp;4.5.2 and 4.5.3 hereof, items of income, gain,
loss, deduction and credit to be allocated for income tax purposes (collectively, &#147;Tax Items&#148;)
shall be allocated among the Partners on the same basis as their respective book items.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.5.2 <U>Sections&nbsp;1245/1250 Recapture</U>. If any portion of gain from the sale of property
is treated as gain which is ordinary income by virtue of the application of Code Sections&nbsp;1245 or
1250 (&#147;Affected Gain&#148;), then (A)&nbsp;such Affected Gain shall be allocated among the Partners in the
same proportion that the depreciation and amortization deductions giving rise to the Affected Gain
were allocated and (B)&nbsp;other Tax Items of gain of the same character that would have been
recognized, but for the application of Sections&nbsp;1245 and/or 1250 of the Code, shall be allocated
away from those Partners who are allocated Affected Gain pursuant to clause (A)&nbsp;so that, to the
extent possible, the other Partners are allocated the same amount, and type, of capital gain that
would have been allocated to them had Sections&nbsp;1245 and/or 1250 of the Code not applied. For
purposes of the prior sentence, each Partner shall be treated as having been allocated depreciation
and amortization in the same proportion as such Partner (before, on or after the date of this
Agreement), has been allocated any deductions, directly or indirectly, giving rise to the Affected
Gain.




<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">-&nbsp;16&nbsp;-
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">
<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.5.3 <U>Allocations Respecting Section 704(c) and Revaluations</U>. Notwithstanding Section
4.5.1 hereof, Tax Items with respect to all Company property that is subject to Section 704(c) of
the Code and/or Sections&nbsp;1.704-1(b)(2)(iv)(d) and/or (f)&nbsp;of the Regulations (collectively &#147;Section
704(c) Tax Items&#148;) shall be allocated in accordance with Regulation&nbsp;Section&nbsp;1.704-3(b).


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.6 <U>Net Gains from Sales</U>. Net Gains from Sales shall be allocated as follows: A
percentage of the Net Gains from Sales shall be allocated to the
Advanta Partners and the balance shall be allocated to the Fleet Partners. The percentage referred to in the immediately preceding
sentence shall be determined by dividing the amount by which the Company Transferred Liabilities
exceeds the federal income tax adjusted basis of the Company Transferred Assets (as such terms are
defined in the Contribution Agreement) by the outstanding Company &#147;excess nonrecourse liabilities&#148;
(within the meaning of Section&nbsp;1.752-3(a)(3) of the Regulations) at the end of the fiscal year or
at other applicable times (including immediately before a disposition giving rise to Net Gains from
Sales) and expressing the resulting decimal as a percentage. The percentage of the Net Gains from
Sales allocated to the Advanta Partners, as a group, shall be allocated among them in the same
proportion that: (x)&nbsp;the amount by which the Company Transferred Liabilities attributable to the
Partner exceeds the federal income tax adjusted basis of the Company Contributed Assets
attributable to that Partner bears to (y)&nbsp;the total of such amounts for all Advanta Partners.



<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.7 <U>General</U>.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.7.1 If an Interest in the Company is transferred and/or modified in accordance with the
provisions of this Agreement, there shall be allocated to each Partner who held the transferred
and/or modified Interest in the Company during the fiscal year of the transfer and/or modification
the product of (a)&nbsp;the Company&#146;s Net Income or Net Loss allocable to such transferred and/or
modified Interest for such fiscal year, and (b)&nbsp;a fraction, the numerator of which is the number of
days such Partner held the transferred and/or modified Interest during such fiscal year, and the
denominator of which is the total number of days in such fiscal year; <I>provided, however, </I>that if a
Partner requests, such Net Income or Net Loss shall be allocated by closing the books of the
Company immediately after the transfer and/or modification of an Interest in the Company. Such
allocation shall be made without regard to the date, amount or recipient of any distributions which
may have been made with respect to such transferred Interest.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.7.2 The &#147;excess nonrecourse liabilities&#148; of the Company (within the meaning of Section
1.752-3(a)(3) of the Regulations) shall be allocated to the Partners consistent with their
percentages in the Company&#146;s Net Gains from Sales determined under Section&nbsp;4.6. The Company shall
compute the amount of non-recourse liabilities allocable to the Advanta Partners in such manner,
and utilizing such convention, so as to maximize the amount of non-recourse liabilities allocable
to the Advanta Partners under Section&nbsp;1.752-3(a)(2) of the Regulations. The Company may rely upon
the opinion of recognized tax counsel in making any such allocation, the cost of such tax counsel
being borne solely by Advanta.



<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">-&nbsp;17&nbsp;-
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>
<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.7.3 The Company shall use commercially reasonable efforts to send a notice to the Advanta
Partners on October&nbsp;30 of each fiscal year (or if the fiscal year does not end on December&nbsp;31, the
last day of the first month of the fourth fiscal quarter), setting forth the amount of the
liabilities of the Company that the Company expects will be includible in the income tax basis of
each of the Advanta Partners at the close of the current fiscal year of the Company, taking into
account the transactions of the Company that occurred or are anticipated to occur, and the
liabilities of the Company that were incurred or are anticipated to be incurred, on or before the
close of the Company&#146;s current fiscal year. Such notice shall specify the relevant tax character
of the liabilities, <I>e.g.</I>, nonrecourse liabilities, partner nonrecourse liabilities under Section
752 and the Regulations thereunder, and the provision of the
Section&nbsp;752 Regulations that result in the allocation of such
liability or liabilities, or portion thereof, to the Advanta Partners. The
Company agrees that, if requested by any Advanta Partner from time to time, the Company will permit
the Advanta Partners to guarantee or otherwise assume the risk of loss with respect to indebtedness
of the Company, in such amount and pursuant to a guarantee or other agreement in form and substance
satisfactory to Advanta, and shall deliver any such guarantees or other agreements to lenders to
the Company, as requested by Advanta and upon receipt thereof by the Company, and shall use its
reasonable best efforts to cause any such lender to acknowledge such guarantee or other agreement
prior to the close of the Company&#146;s taxable year in which any such guarantee is presented to the
Company. Advanta agrees to bear any costs incurred by the Company in carrying out its obligations
under this Section&nbsp;4.7.3.



<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt"><B>5. </B><U><B>SECTION 5 &#151; MANAGEMENT: RIGHTS, POWERS, AND DUTIES</B></U>



<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;5.1 <U>General Partner</U> . The Company shall be managed by the General Partner. The General
Partner shall have all power and authority to manage the Company for and on behalf of the Partners and
shall do all lawful acts and things as are not directed or required to be exercised or done by the Partners
under the Act or this Agreement. Approval by or action taken by the General Partner, in accordance with this
Agreement, shall constitute approval or action by the Company and shall be binding upon the
Partners.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;5.2 <U>Authority of the General Partner</U>. Subject to Section&nbsp;5.7 hereof, the General
Partner shall, in addition to any other power granted to it in this Agreement, have the right,
power and authority to take all actions with respect to the operations of the Company.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;5.3 <U>Committees</U>. The General Partner may designate one or more committees. Each
committee shall be composed of such number of members as the General Partner may determine. Any
committee, to the extent provided by the General Partner, shall have and may exercise all of the
power and authority of the General Partner.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;5.4 <U>Meetings and Voting</U>. Any action required or permitted to be taken by the Partners,
either at a meeting or otherwise, may be taken without a meeting if the Partners having the
requisite numbers of votes to take such action consent thereto in writing. Written notice of any
such action taken by written consent of the Partners will be given by the Chief Executive Officer
or Secretary of the Company to all Partners promptly after such action has been taken.


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">- 18 -
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;5.5 <U>Executive Officers</U>. The General Partner may appoint employees from nominees of
the Fleet Partners to hold the positions of chief executive officer (the &#147;Chief Executive
Officer&#148;), chief financial officer, secretary, and one or more vice presidents (each an &#147;Executive
Officer&#148;), with such duties as may be established by the General Partner. The Chief Executive
Officer, if any, appointed by the General Partner shall conduct the day-to-day affairs of the
Company. The General Partner may also appoint officers of the Company and designate the duties to
be performed by such officers in accordance herewith.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;5.6 <U>Personal Services</U>. No Partner shall be required to perform services for the
Company solely by virtue of being a Partner. Unless approved by the General Partner, no Partner
shall be entitled to compensation for services performed for the Company. However, upon
substantiation of the amount and purpose thereof, a Partner shall be
entitled to reimbursement for expenses reasonably incurred in connection with the activities of the Company.



<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;5.7 <U>Voting Rights of Partners</U> . Notwithstanding any other provisions of this Agreement,
each of the following actions by a Partner or by the Company requires the affirmative vote of a majority
of the Interests owned by the Advanta Partners, excluding any such action (other than as set forth in
Section&nbsp;5.7.7) with respect to which the Company requests and has received (i)&nbsp;from counsel mutually
acceptable to Fleet and Advanta a written opinion that such action will not have an adverse tax effect
upon the Advanta Partners and, (ii)&nbsp;from Advanta&#146;s regularly employed accountants, a written opinion that such
action will not give rise to any requirement that the Advanta Partners create or increase any
reserve (other than a reserve relating to the Book/Tax Differential) for income taxes for financial
reporting purposes.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;5.7.1 approving (i)&nbsp;any Additional Capital Contributions, (ii)&nbsp;the admission of any other
Partners or (iii)&nbsp;any other act, if any such action would reduce the Percentage owned by the
Advanta Partners below one percent in the aggregate;


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;5.7.2 reducing the amount of indebtedness of the Company which can be allocated to any Advanta
Partner below the amount of such Advanta Partner&#146;s deficit balance in its capital account (as
calculated for federal income tax purposes);


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;5.7.3 approving any sale, transfer or other disposition of the goodwill, going concern value,
or the value attributable to the workforce in place contributed to the LLC (and assumed by the
Company) by Advanta or any of its Affiliates (the &#147;Restricted Sale Assets&#148;); <I>provided, however,</I>
that the parties agree the Company is permitted to sell, transfer or otherwise dispose of portions
of the Restricted Sale Assets if such sales, transfers or other dispositions are in the ordinary
course of the Company&#146;s business and would not result in the recognition of gain or income to the
Advanta Partners under Section 704(c) of the Code;


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;5.7.4 discontinuing the operation of the Advanta Credit Card Business or cause the dissolution
of the Company unless prior thereto, the Advanta Partners are offered an

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">- 19 -
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">opportunity to acquire
such Advanta Credit Card Business on terms mutually acceptable to the parties;


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;5.7.5 making any election that would result in the Company being taxed as other than a
&#147;partnership&#148; for federal income tax purposes, including (but not limited to) electing to be taxed
as other than a &#147;partnership&#148; by filing Form&nbsp;8832, &#147;Entity Classification Election&#148; or making any
election inconsistent with Section&nbsp;4.5.3 hereof;


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;5.7.6 for seven years after the Closing Date, making any distribution of Company property
(other than money) to any Advanta Partner other than pursuant to the provisions of Section&nbsp;5.7.4;
or


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;5.7.7 approving any activities of the Company that are not part of, or incidental to, the
business of banking or are not permissible for an operating subsidiary of a national bank.

<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;5.8 <U>Duties of Parties</U>.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;5.8.1 Each Partner shall devote such time to the business and affairs of the Company as is
necessary to carry out the Partner&#146;s duties set forth in this Agreement.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;5.8.2 No Partner shall provide, disclose, or otherwise make available to the Company any
Non-Public Information. The Company shall not provide, disclose, or otherwise make available to
any Partner any Company Non-Public Information. No Partner shall make available to any other
Partner any of its Non-Public Information. The parties hereto each acknowledge and agree that the
covenants and restrictions set forth in this Section&nbsp;5.8.2 are specifically intended to limit the
rights of the Partners under Section&nbsp;7-13-5 of the Act, to the extent allowed by the Act.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;5.8.3 The Partners shall take any action that may be required to ensure that the activities of
the Company are limited to activities that are part of, or incidental to, the business of banking
and are permissible for an operating subsidiary of a national bank.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt"><B>6. </B><U><B>SECTION 6 &#151; LIABILITY AND INDEMNIFICATION</B></U>



<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;6.1 <U>Liability of Partners</U>.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;Except as otherwise provided by the Act, this Agreement or any Transaction Document,
Partners shall not be liable, responsible or otherwise accountable for damages to the Company or to
any Partner for any action taken or failure to act on behalf of the Company, unless such acts or
omissions were fraudulent, in bad faith or a result of wanton or willful misconduct or gross
negligence by such Partner. No Limited Partner shall be liable for any of the debts, liabilities
or obligations of the Company.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;Except as otherwise expressly required by law, a Partner, in its capacity as such, shall
have no liability in respect of any distributions wrongfully distributed to it.



<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">- 20 -
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;6.2 <U>Indemnification of Partners</U>. To the extent permitted by law, the Company shall
indemnify, defend and hold harmless each Covered Person from and against any and all debts, losses,
claims, damages, costs, demands, fines, judgments, contracts (implied and expressed, written and
unwritten), penalties, obligations, payments, liabilities of every type and nature (whether known
