</DOCUMENT>
<DOCUMENT>
<TYPE>EX-10.CC
<SEQUENCE>9
<FILENAME>w06406exv10wcc.htm
<DESCRIPTION>ADVANTA CORP. OFFICE OF THE CHAIRMAN SUPPLEMENTAL COMPENSATION PLAN
<TEXT>
<HTML>
<HEAD>
<TITLE>exv10wcc</TITLE>
</HEAD>
<BODY bgcolor="#FFFFFF">
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>
<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">



<P align="right" style="font-size: 10pt"><B>Exhibit&nbsp;10-cc</B>



<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><B>ADVANTA CORP.<BR>
OFFICE OF THE CHAIRMAN<BR>
SUPPLEMENTAL COMPENSATION PROGRAM</B>



<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt"><B>SECTION 1. </B><U><B>PURPOSE</B></U>



<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On May&nbsp;22, 1997, the Board of Directors of Advanta Corp. (the &#147;Company&#148;) approved the adoption
of a plan to provide supplemental compensation arrangements for the members of the Office of the
Chairman in the event of a Change in Control of the Company. Accordingly, the Company has adopted
this Office of the Chairman Supplemental Compensation Program (this &#147;Program&#148;) in accordance with
the resolutions (the &#147;Resolutions&#148;) adopted by the Board of Directors.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt"><B>SECTION 2. </B><U><B>ELIGIBILITY</B></U>



<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.1 Each of Dennis Alter, Alex W. Hart and William A. Rosoff (each an &#147;Employee&#148;) shall be
eligible to receive Supplemental Compensation if and only if all of the following conditions are
met (and the Employee is not disqualified from eligibility pursuant to Section&nbsp;2.2):


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;The Employee is an employee of the Company at the time a Change of Control occurs; and


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;The Employee is terminated from employment within three (3)&nbsp;years after the Change of
Control occurs; unless such termination is: (1)&nbsp;because of the Employee&#146;s Disability or Extended
Leave of Absence or death, (2)&nbsp;because of the Employee&#146;s Willful Misconduct, or (3)&nbsp;by the Employee
other than for Good Reason. In the event an Employee&#146;s employment is terminated for any reason
prior to the occurrence of a Change of Control, he shall not be entitled to any benefits under this
Program by virtue of said Change of Control.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(i)&nbsp;If, as a result of an Employee&#146;s incapacity due to physical or mental illness, or as a
result of any other leave of absence, the Employee shall have been absent from the full-time
performance of his duties for twelve (12)&nbsp;consecutive months after the date of a Change of Control,
the Employee may be terminated and shall not be entitled to any benefits under this Program.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(ii)&nbsp;If the employment of the Employee is terminated for the Willful Misconduct of the
Employee, the Employee shall not be entitled to any benefits under this Program. Termination of
the Employee&#146;s employment for Willful Misconduct shall mean termination:


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(A)&nbsp;Upon the willful and continued failure by the Employee to perform a material and
substantial part of his duties which the Employee fails to cure (other than any such failure
resulting from incapacity due to physical or mental illness or an Extended Leave of Absence or the
Employee&#146;s termination of his


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">
<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">employment for Good Reason), after thirty (30)&nbsp;days from a written demand for substantial
performance is delivered to the Employee by the Company, which demand specifically identifies the
manner in which the Company believes that the Employee has not substantially performed his duties;
or



<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(B)&nbsp;Upon the commission by the Employee of a felony or of any act of willful fraud,
misappropriation or dishonesty, in any case, provided that such act is materially injurious to the
Company.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(iii)&nbsp;The Employee shall be entitled to terminate his employment for Good Reason and receive
Supplemental Compensation. The Employee&#146;s right to terminate his own employment pursuant to this
Subsection shall not be affected by his or incapacity due to physical or mental illness. The
Employee&#146;s continued employment shall not constitute consent to, or a waiver of rights with respect
to, any circumstance constituting Good Reason. &#147;Good Reason&#148; shall mean, without the Employee&#146;s
express prior written consent, the occurrence after a Change of Control of any of the following
circumstances:


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(A)&nbsp;The Employee is assigned any responsibilities less significant than, or duties
inconsistent with the status or the position that, the Employee held immediately prior to the
Change of Control or an adverse alteration in the nature or status of the Employee&#146;s
responsibilities or in the quality or function of office accommodations, amenities or assistance
provided to the Employee, from those in effect immediately prior to such Change of Control;


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(B)&nbsp;A reduction in any of the Employee&#146;s compensation as in effect on the date immediately
prior to the Change of Control, or as the same may be increased from time to time thereafter,
including, without limitation, the Employee&#146;s annual base salary;


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(C)&nbsp;The Company&#146;s requirement that the Employee&#146;s site of principal employment be more than 50
miles from the offices at which the Employee was principally employed immediately prior to the date
of the Change of Control, except for required travel on the Company&#146;s business to an extent
substantially consistent with the Employee&#146;s business travel obligations immediately prior to such
Change of Control;


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(D)&nbsp;The failure by the Company to pay to the Employee any portion of his compensation or
compensation under any deferred compensation program of the Company within fifteen (15)&nbsp;days of the
date such compensation is due;


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(E)&nbsp;The failure by the Company to continue in effect for the benefit of the Employee any
benefit plan or perquisites in which the Employee participates immediately prior to the Change of
Control, unless an equitable arrangement satisfactory to the Employee (embodied in an ongoing
substitute or alternative plan) has been made in writing with and executed by the Employee with


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">- 2 -
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">
<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">respect to such plan, or the failure by the Company to continue the Employee&#146;s participation
therein (or in such substitute or alternative plan) on a basis not less favorable, both in terms of
the amount of benefits provided and the level of the Employee&#146;s participation relative to other
participants, than existed at the time of the Change of Control;



<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(F)&nbsp;The failure by the Company to continue to provide the Employee with benefits substantially
similar to those enjoyed by him under any of the life insurance, medical, dental, accident or
disability plans provided by the Company in which the Employee was participating at the time of the
Change of Control, the taking of any action by the Company which would directly or indirectly
reduce any of such benefits to the Employee, or the failure by the Company to provide the Employee
with the number of paid vacation days or Paid Time Off days to which the Employee is entitled on
the basis of his years of service and position with the Company in accordance with the vacation or
Paid Time Off policy applicable and in effect at the time of the Change of Control;


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(G)&nbsp;The failure of the Company to obtain the unqualified agreement from any successor to
assume this Program pursuant to the provisions of Section&nbsp;5.1 below; or


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(H)&nbsp;Any material breach by the Company of the terms of this Program or any other employment,
compensation or other similar agreement between the Employee and the Company;


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(c)&nbsp;For purposes of this Program, a &#147;Change of Control&#148; shall be deemed to have occurred upon
the earliest to occur of the following events: (i)&nbsp;the date the stockholders of the Company (or
the Board of Directors, if stockholder action is not required) approve a plan or other arrangement
pursuant to which the Company will be dissolved or liquidated, or (ii)&nbsp;the date the stockholders of
the Company (or the Board of Directors, if stockholder action is not required) approve a definitive
agreement to sell or otherwise dispose of assets of the Company (including, without limitation,
stock of any of its wholly owned or majority-owned subsidiaries) which assets have an aggregate
market value equal to 50% or more of the aggregate market value of either of (<U>y</U>) the total
owned assets of the Company or (<U>z</U>) the total managed assets of the Company, in each such
case, determined on a consolidated basis, or (iii)&nbsp;the date the stockholders of the Company (or the
Board of Directors, if stockholder action is not required) approve a definitive agreement pursuant
to which the Company would cease to have the exclusive power to manage assets of the Company or
control all material decisions with respect to assets of the Company which assets, in either such
case, have an aggregate market value equal to 50% or more of the aggregate market value of either
of (<U>y</U>) the total owned assets of the Company or (<U>z</U>) the total managed assets of the
Company, in each such case, determined on a consolidated basis, or (iv)&nbsp;the date the stockholders
of the Company (or the Board of Directors, if stockholder action is not required) and the
stockholders of the other constituent corporation (or its board of directors if stockholder action
is not required) have approved a definitive agreement to merge or consolidate the Company with or
into such other corporation, other than, in either case, a merger or consolidation


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">- 3 -
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>


<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">
<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">of the Company in which holders of shares of the Company&#146;s Class&nbsp;A Common Stock immediately
prior to the merger or consolidation will have at least a majority of the voting power of the
surviving corporation&#146;s voting securities immediately after the merger or consolidation, which
voting securities are to be held in the same proportion as such holders&#146; ownership of Class&nbsp;A
Common Stock of the Company immediately before the merger or consolidation, or (v)&nbsp;the date any
entity, person or group, within the meaning of Section&nbsp;13(d)(3) or Section&nbsp;14(d)(2) of the
Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended (other than (<U>x</U>) the Company or any of its
subsidiaries or any trustee or other fiduciary holding securities under an employee benefit plan or
related trust sponsored or maintained by the Company or any of its subsidiaries or any person
acting on behalf of the Company as an underwriter pursuant to an offering who is temporarily
holding securities in connection with such offering or (<U>y</U>) any person who, on the date this
Program is effective, shall have been the beneficial owner of or have voting control over shares of
Common Stock of the Company possessing more than twenty-five percent (25%) of the aggregate voting
power of the Company&#146;s Common Stock) shall have become the beneficial owner of, or shall have
obtained voting control over, more than twenty-five percent (25%) of the outstanding shares of the
Company&#146;s Class&nbsp;A Common Stock, or (vi)&nbsp;the first day after the date this Program is effective when
directors are elected such that a majority of the Board of Directors shall have been members of the
Board of Directors for less than two (2)&nbsp;years, unless the nomination for election of each new
director who was not a director at the beginning of such two (2)&nbsp;year period was approved by a vote
of at least two-thirds of the directors then still in office who were directors at the beginning of
such period.



<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.2 An Employee may not receive Supplemental Compensation if, at the time of the Change of
Control, the Employee is party to an agreement with the Company pursuant to which the Employee has
agreed that his employment will terminate in the future on a date certain which is less than three
years after the date of the Change of Control.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt"><B>SECTION 3. SUPPLEMENTAL COMPENSATION AMOUNT</B>



<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3.1 The Supplemental Compensation to be paid to an eligible Employee shall be determined by
the Compensation Committee of the Board of Directors of the Company (or if no such committee
exists, the non-employee members of the Board of Directors); <U>provided</U>, <U>however</U>,
that, subject to the terms of the Resolutions, the Supplemental Compensation to be paid to an
eligible Employee shall in no event exceed five million dollars ($5,000,000.00) and shall be no
less than three million dollars ($3,000,000.00). In making a determination with respect to the
amount of Supplemental Compensation to be paid to an eligible Employee, all facts and circumstances
surrounding the Change of Control shall be considered, including, without limitation, the economic
value realized by the Company or its stockholders in the Change of Control, the efforts of the
Employee in effecting the transaction resulting in the Change of Control and the leadership
demonstrated by the Employee during the period between the effective date of this Program and the
date of the Change of Control. The amount of Supplemental Compensation shall be determined prior
to the date of the Change of Control; <U>provided</U>, <U>however</U>, that if because of the
nature of the Change of Control the Compensation


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">- 4 -
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">
<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">Committee of the Board does not have sufficient notice to determine the amount of the
Supplemental Compensation prior to the Change of Control, then the amount of the Supplemental
Compensation shall be determined by majority vote of the non-employee members of the Board of
Directors of the Company who were members of the Board of Directors of the Company immediately
prior to the Change of Control. Notwithstanding the foregoing, the Employee shall have the right,
in his sole discretion, by notice to the Company, to reduce the amount of Supplemental Compensation
(determined in the manner set forth above) which is payable to him.



<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3.2 To the extent that a federal, state or local law requires the Company to make a payment to
an Employee because of that Employee&#146;s involuntary termination of employment and such payment is
made to the Employee, the amount payable under this Program shall be correspondingly reduced by the
net amount paid to the Employee. No other compensation, benefits or other amounts payable to an
Employee shall reduce the amount payable under this Program, whether such amounts payable result
from salary, bonus, deferred compensation, stock awards or other compensation during the term of
his employment or unemployment compensation, short-term disability, worker&#146;s compensation or
long-term disability payments, if any, which may be paid to Employee after the Employee&#146;s
employment with the Company ceases. For the avoidance of doubt, to the extent that an Employee
receives severance pay in connection with the cessation of his employment other than pursuant to
this Program (whether pursuant to a contract or other severance plan or policy or any other benefit
plan which is not a severance plan), the amount payable under this Program shall not be affected by
any such payments.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt"><B>SECTION 4. DISTRIBUTION OF PAYMENTS</B>



<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.1 Payments will be made in a single lump sum payment or as may otherwise be specified by the
Employee in his sole discretion. Such payment shall be made on the date upon which the Employee&#146;s
employment with the Company ceases and shall be made as designated by the Employee until all
amounts due are paid in full.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.2 If any portion of the Supplemental Compensation to which an Employee is eligible pursuant
to Section&nbsp;2.1 has not been paid in full prior to the death of such Employee, the balance of such
Supplemental Compensation shall be paid to the estate of such Employee.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.3 Prior to the date of the Change of Control, the Company will deposit in a &#147;rabbi trust&#148;
established for the sole benefit of the Employees and in form and substance reasonably satisfactory
to the Employees, the full amount of Supplemental Compensation which may become due to all
Employees pursuant to this Program. If because of the nature of the Change of Control the
Compensation Committee of the Board of Directors of the Company does not have sufficient notice to
determine the amount of the Supplemental Compensation prior to the Change of Control, then as
promptly after the Change of Control as practicable, the Company will deposit in the &#147;rabbi trust&#148;
the full amount of Supplemental Compensation which may become due to all Employees pursuant to this
Program. The amount of funds in the &#147;rabbi trust&#148; may be reduced by one dollar for each dollar of
Supplemental Compensation paid to an Employee pursuant


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">- 5 -
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">
<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">to the terms of this Program. Any funds remaining in the &#147;rabbi trust&#148; on the three year
anniversary of the Change of Control which are not payable to an eligible Employee or his estate
pursuant to the terms of this Program may be returned to the Company at any time after such
anniversary.



<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt"><B>SECTION 5. GENERAL PROVISIONS</B>



<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;5.1 The effective date of this Program is May&nbsp;22, 1997. If a Change of Control occurs, this
Program may not be modified, amended or terminated until three (3)&nbsp;years after the Change of
Control occurs. This Program shall be assumed by, and the obligations hereunder shall become the
obligations of, any successor to the business and/or assets of Advanta Corp., whether by operation
of law, or otherwise, and the term &#147;Company&#148; shall be deemed to mean such successor (other than in
the definition of Change of Control set forth in Subsection 2.1(c)).


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;5.2 To the extent not preempted by federal law, this Program and any and all disputes relating
thereto shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the Commonwealth of
Pennsylvania without giving effect to the principles of conflicts of law thereof.



<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">- 6 -
</DIV>

<DOCUMENT>
<TYPE>EX-10.DD
<SEQUENCE>10
<FILENAME>w06406exv10wdd.htm
<DESCRIPTION>ADVANTA SENIOR MANAGEMENT CHANGE OF CONTROL SEVERANCE PLAN RESTATED DECEMBER 21, 2000
<TEXT>
<HTML>
<HEAD>
<TITLE>exv10wdd</TITLE>
</HEAD>
<BODY bgcolor="#FFFFFF">
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>
<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">



<P align="right" style="font-size: 10pt">Exhibit&nbsp;10-dd



<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><B>ADVANTA SENIOR MANAGEMENT<BR>
CHANGE OF CONTROL SEVERANCE PLAN<BR>
RESTATED DECEMBER 21, 2000</B>



<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt"><B>SECTION 1. </B><U><B>PURPOSE</B></U>



<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Advanta Corp. (the &#147;Company&#148;) considers it essential to its best interests to foster the
optimum performance of senior management and professional personnel. The Company recognizes that
the possibility of a Change in Control of the Company or any of its Subsidiaries may exist and that
such possibility, and the uncertainty and questions which it may raise, may result in the
distraction of management or professional personnel to the detriment of the Company and/or its
Subsidiaries.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In order to encourage senior management and professional personnel to maintain their continued
attention and dedication to their duties and responsibilities, the Company and its Subsidiaries
have adopted the Advanta Corp. Senior Management Change of Control Severance Plan.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt"><B>SECTION 2. </B><U><B>DEFINITIONS</B></U>



<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As hereinafter used:


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.1 A &#147;Change of Control&#148; shall be deemed to have occurred upon the earliest to occur of the
following events: (i)&nbsp;the date the stockholders of the Company (or the Board of Directors, if
stockholder action is not required) approve a plan or other arrangement pursuant to which the
Company will be dissolved or liquidated, or (ii)&nbsp;the date the stockholders of the Company (or the
Board of Directors, if stockholder action is not required) approve a definitive agreement to sell
or otherwise dispose of substantially all of the assets of the Company, or (iii)&nbsp;the date the
stockholders of the Company (or the Board of Directors, if stockholder action is not required) and
the stockholders of the other constituent corporation (or its board of directors if stockholder
action is not required) have approved a definitive agreement to merge or consolidate the Company
with or into such other corporation, other than, in either case, a merger or consolidation of the
Company in which holders of shares of the Company&#146;s Class&nbsp;A Common Stock immediately prior to the
merger or consolidation will have at least a majority of the voting power of the surviving
corporation&#146;s voting securities immediately after the merger or consolidation, which voting
securities are to be held in the same proportion as such holders&#146; ownership of Class&nbsp;A Common Stock
of the Company immediately before the merger or consolidation, or (iv)&nbsp;the date any entity, person
or group, within the meaning of Section&nbsp;13(d)(3) or Section&nbsp;14(d)(2) of the Securities Exchange Act
of 1934, as amended (other than (a)&nbsp;the Company or any of its subsidiaries or any employee benefit
plan &#091;or related trust&#093; sponsored or maintained by the Company or any of its subsidiaries or (b)
any person who, on the date the Plan


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">1
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>


<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">is effective, shall have been the beneficial owner of or have voting control over shares of
Common Stock of the Company possessing more than twenty-five percent (25%) of the aggregate voting
power of the Company&#146;s Common Stock) shall have become the beneficial owner of, or shall have
obtained voting control over, more than twenty-five percent (25%) of the outstanding shares of the
Company&#146;s Class&nbsp;A Common Stock, or (v)&nbsp;the first day after the date this Plan is effective when
directors are elected such that a majority of the Board of Directors shall have been members of the
Board of Directors for less than two (2)&nbsp;years, unless the nomination for election of each new
director who was not a director at the beginning of such two (2)&nbsp;year period was approved by a vote
of at least two-thirds of the directors then still in office who were directors at the beginning of
such period.



<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.2(a) A &#147;Subsidiary Change of Control&#148; shall be deemed to have occurred if the Company or one
of its wholly-owned or majority-owned subsidiaries (said subsidiary not necessarily being a
&#147;Subsidiary&#148; as defined under Section&nbsp;2.4 of this Plan) no longer hold any shares of the
Subsidiary, or if substantially all of the assets of a particular Subsidiary are sold to an entity
that is not owned or controlled, in whole or in part, by the Company or one of its wholly-owned or
majority-owned subsidiaries.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;A &#147; Subsidiary Change of Control&#148; shall also be deemed to have occurred as of the Closing
Date with respect to all Employees who either (i)&nbsp;are Buyer
Employees, or (ii)&nbsp;are determined by the Company&#146;s head of Human Resources to have been terminated
by Advanta Corp. or a Subsidiary on the Closing Date or after the Closing Date as a direct result
of a Subsidiary Change of Control.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.3 &#147;Company&#148; means Advanta Corp., and any successor to its business and/or assets which
assumes and agrees or is otherwise obligated to provide benefits under the Plan by operation of
law, or otherwise. Notwithstanding the foregoing, for purposes of Section&nbsp;2.1 (&#147;Change of
Control&#148;) or Section&nbsp;2.2 (&#147;Subsidiary Change of Control&#148;), the &#147;Company&#148; shall mean &#147;Advanta Corp.&#148;
The &#147;Company&#148; does not mean a Buyer.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.4 &#147;Subsidiary&#148; means Advanta National Bank; Advanta National Bank USA; Advanta Bank Corp.;
Advanta Service Corp.; Advanta Mortgage Corp. USA; Advanta Auto Finance Corp.; Advanta Finance
Corp.; Advanta Business Services Corp.; Advanta Financial Corp.; Advanta Life Insurance Company;
Advanta Information Services, Inc.; Advanta Partners, LP; Colorado Credit Card Service, LLP;
Advanta Mortgage Conduit Services, Inc.; Advanta Mortgage Corp., Midwest or any successor to any
particular Subsidiary&#146;s business and/or assets, due to a Change of Control or Subsidiary Change of
Control, which assumes and agrees or is otherwise obligated to provide benefits under the Plan, by
operation of law, or otherwise. A &#147;Subsidiary&#148; does not mean a Buyer. An Employee is employed by
a specific Subsidiary if he or she: (a)&nbsp;is on the payroll of the specific Subsidiary or, in the
case of Advanta National Bank or Advanta National Bank, USA is on the payroll of Advanta Service
Corp. and performs services on a full-time basis for such bank; or (b)&nbsp;is an officer of the
specific Subsidiary and exercises direct supervisory responsibility over employees of that specific
Subsidiary and performs virtually all of his or her business duties on behalf of that specific
Subsidiary.


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">2
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<P>
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

    <TD width="3%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="4%" nowrap align="left">2.5&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>The &#147;Effective Date&#148; of the Plan is March&nbsp;17, 1997.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD colspan="5">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="4%" nowrap align="left">2.6&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>The &#147;Board of Directors&#148; is the Board of Directors of the Company.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD colspan="5">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="4%" nowrap align="left">2.7&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>An &#147;Employee&#148; means a person</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;who has been selected by the Company&#146;s Compensation Committee to participate in the
Advanta Management Incentive Plan or who is otherwise selected to participate in this Plan; and



<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;whose name is listed in Exhibits &#147;A&#148; or &#147;B&#148; hereto, as such Exhibits may be amended or
supplemented from time to time; and



<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(c)&nbsp;who is employed by the Company or a Subsidiary at the time of a change of a Change of
Control or by a specific Subsidiary at the time it undergoes a Subsidiary Change of Control.



<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The term &#147;Employee&#148; specifically excludes any person (a)&nbsp;who is receiving severance pay from
the Company or any Subsidiary or (b)&nbsp;who signed an agreement pursuant to which his or her
employment will terminate in the future on a date certain.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.8 &#147;Pay&#148; means the base salary of an eligible Employee at his or her stated weekly, monthly
or annual rate as of the Employee&#146;s Termination Date or at the time of the Change of Control or
Subsidiary Change of Control pursuant to which the Employee becomes eligible for Severance Pay,
whichever is higher. &#147;Pay&#148; does not include overtime pay, bonuses of any kind, incentive pay or
any other remuneration. For Employees listed in Exhibit &#147;A,&#148; a &#147;Week of Pay&#148; shall be calculated
in accordance with the regular payroll practices and procedures applicable immediately preceding
the Change of Control of Subsidiary Change of Control. Notwithstanding the foregoing, for
Employees listed in Exhibit &#147;B,&#148; a &#147;Week of Pay&#148; shall be calculated in the same manner as
Employees listed in Exhibit &#147;A&#148;, multiplied by 200%.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.9 The &#147;Plan&#148; means the Advanta Corp. Senior Management Change of Control Severance Pay Plan
as set forth herein as amended from time to time.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.10 &#147;Termination Date&#148; means the date upon which the Employee&#146;s employment with the Company,
Subsidiary or a Buyer ceases.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.11 The &#147;Benefits Committee&#148; means a committee composed of the Company&#146;s head of Human
Resources; head of Compensation and Benefits; and head of Employee Relations . Any two (2)&nbsp;such
persons shall constitute a quorum. All members of the Benefits Committee must be employed by
Advanta Corp. prior to the time a Change of Control occurs.


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">3
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.12 &#147;Severance Pay&#148; is a payment made to an eligible Employee pursuant to Section&nbsp;3.1
hereof. All Severance Pay due to an eligible Employee must be paid to the eligible Employee within
two (2)&nbsp;years of the date that the first Severance Pay is paid to that Employee and shall not
exceed two (2)&nbsp;years&#146; of Pay.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.13 The &#147;Compensation Committee&#148; means the Compensation Committee of the Board of Directors
of Advanta Corp.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.14 A &#147;Buyer Employee&#148; means an Employee who is designated in writing by the Company&#146;s head
of Human Resources as having become an employee of a Buyer pursuant to a Subsidiary Change of
Control.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.15 A &#147;Buyer&#148; means an entity that: (a)&nbsp;is designated in writing by the Compensation
Committee as having purchased substantially all of the assets of a Subsidiary; (b)&nbsp;is not owned or
controlled, in whole or in part, by the Company or one of its wholly-owned or majority-owned
Subsidiaries; and (c)&nbsp;does not adopt this Plan.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.16 The &#147;Closing Date&#148; means the date the transactions that are contemplated by an agreement
with a Buyer and constitute a Subsidiary Change of Control close.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt"><B>SECTION 3. </B><U><B>ELIGIBILITY</B></U>



<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3.1 An Employee shall be eligible to receive Severance Pay if and only if all of the following
conditions are met (and the Employee is not disqualified from eligibility pursuant to Section&nbsp;3.2):


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;The Employee is an Employee of the Company or a Subsidiary after the Effective Date of the
Plan; and



<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;The Employee is a Buyer Employee or is employed by:



<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(i)&nbsp;Advanta Corp. at the time a Change of Control occurs;


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(ii)&nbsp;Advanta National Bank, Advanta National Bank USA, Advanta Bank Corp.:Advanta Service
Corp, Advanta Mortgage Corp. USA, Advanta Auto Finance Corp., Advanta Finance Corp., Advanta
Business Services Corp., Advanta Financial Corp., Advanta Life Insurance Company, Advanta
Information Services, Inc., Advanta Partners, LP, Colorado Credit Card Service, LLP, Advanta
Mortgage Conduit Services, Inc., or Advanta Mortgage Corp., Midwest at the time a Change of Control
occurs; provided that Advanta Corp. continues to hold at such time (directly or indirectly) more
than fifty percent (50%) of the outstanding capital stock of the applicable entity; or


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">4
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(iii)&nbsp;Advanta National Bank, Advanta National Bank USA; Advanta Bank Corp.; Advanta Service
Corp., Advanta Mortgage Corp. USA, Advanta Auto Finance Corp., Advanta Finance Corp., Advanta
Business Services Corp., Advanta Financial Corp., Advanta Life Insurance Company, Advanta
Information Services, Inc., Advanta Partners, LP, Colorado Credit Card Service, LLP, Advanta
Mortgage Conduit Services, Inc., or Advanta Mortgage Corp., Midwest at the time it undergoes a
Subsidiary Change of Control; and


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(c)&nbsp;The Employee is terminated from employment by a Buyer within one (1)&nbsp;year after the Change
of Control or Subsidiary Change of Control described in Section&nbsp;2.1, 2.2(a) or 2.2(b) occurs, or by
the Company or Subsidiary as a direct result of said Change of Control or Subsidiary Change of
Control; unless such termination is: (1)&nbsp;because of the Employee&#146;s death, disability, or Extended
Leave of Absence, (2)&nbsp;because of the Employee&#146;s Willful Misconduct, or (3)&nbsp;by the Employee other
than for Good Reason. In the event a person&#146;s employment is terminated for any reason prior to the
occurrence of a Change of Control or a Subsidiary Change of Control, he or she shall not be
entitled to any benefits under the Plan by virtue of said Change of Control or Subsidiary Change of
Control. In the case of a termination by the Company or Subsidiary, eligibility will be
established by a written designation of the Company&#146;s head of Human Resources that the termination
is a result of the Change of Control or Subsidiary Change of Control.



<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(i)&nbsp;<U>Disability or Extended Leave of Absence</U>. If, as a result of an Employee&#146;s
incapacity due to physical or mental illness, or as a result of any other leave of absence, the
Employee shall have been absent from the full-time performance of his or her duties for twelve (12)
consecutive months, the Employee may be terminated and shall not be entitled to any benefits under
the Plan.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(ii)&nbsp;<U>Willful Misconduct</U>. Termination of the Employee&#146;s employment for Willful
Misconduct shall mean termination:


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;Upon the willful and continued failure by the Employee to substantially perform his or her
duties which the Employee fails to cure (other than any such failure resulting from incapacity due
to physical or mental illness or an Extended Leave of Absence or the Employee&#146;s termination of his
or her employment for Good Reason (as defined in Subsection 3.1(c)(iii))), after ten (10)&nbsp;days from
a written demand for substantial performance is delivered to the Employee by the Company or
Subsidiary, by which he or she is employed, which demand specifically identifies the manner in
which the Company or Subsidiary believes that the Employee has not substantially performed his or
her duties; or


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;The willful engaging by the Employee in conduct which is clearly and materially injurious
to a Buyer, the Company and/or Subsidiary, monetarily or otherwise, as determined by the Benefits
Committee, in its sole discretion under this Plan.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(iii)&nbsp;<U>Good Reason</U>. The Employee shall be entitled to terminate his or her employment
for Good Reason and receive Severance Pay, if the Employee provides written


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">5
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">notice to the Benefits Committee no later than two weeks after the Employee&#146;s termination date
of the election to resign and the circumstances constituting the Good Reason to resign. The
Employee&#146;s right to terminate his or her own employment pursuant to this Subsection shall not be
affected by his or her incapacity due to physical or mental illness. The Employee&#146;s continued
employment shall not constitute consent to, or a waiver of rights with respect to, any circumstance
constituting Good Reason. &#147;Good Reason&#148; shall mean, without the Employee&#146;s express written
consent, the occurrence after a Change in Control of the Company or a Subsidiary Change of Control
with respect to the Subsidiary by which he or she was employed of any of the following
circumstances:



<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;The Employee is demoted to a lower position;


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;The Employee is assigned any duties inconsistent with the status of the position that the
Employee held immediately prior to the Change of Control or Subsidiary Change of Control or an
adverse alteration in the nature or status of the Employee&#146;s
responsibilities or in the quality or amount of office accommodations or assistance provided to the
Employee, from those in effect immediately prior to such Subsidiary or Company Change of Control,
which shall constitute a constructive demotion;


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(c)&nbsp;A reduction in the Employee&#146;s annual base salary as in effect on the date immediately
prior to the Change of Control or Subsidiary Change of Control, or as the same may be increased
from time to time thereafter;


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(d)&nbsp;A Buyer&#146;s, the Company&#146;s or Subsidiary&#146;s requirement that the Employee&#146;s site of principal
employment be more than 50 miles from the offices at which the Employee was principally employed
immediately prior to the date of the Change of Control or Subsidiary Change of Control, except for
required travel on a Buyer&#146;s, the Company&#146;s or Subsidiary&#146;s business to an extent substantially
consistent with the Employee&#146;s business travel obligations immediately prior to such Change of
Control or Subsidiary Change of Control;


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(e)&nbsp;The failure by the Company or Subsidiary to pay the Employee any portion of his or her
compensation or compensation under any deferred compensation program of the Company or Subsidiary
within fifteen (15)&nbsp;days of the date such compensation is due;


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(f)&nbsp;The failure by a Buyer, the Company or Subsidiary to continue in effect any compensation
or benefit plan or perquisites in which the Employee participates immediately prior to the Change
of Control or Subsidiary Change of Control, which is material to his or her total compensation,
unless an equitable arrangement (embodied in an ongoing substitute or alternative plan) has been
made with respect to such plan or the failure by the Company or Subsidiary which experienced the
Change in Control to continue the Employee&#146;s participation therein (or in such substitute or
alternative plan) on a basis not materially less favorable, both in terms of the amount of benefits
provided and the level of the Employee&#146;s participation relative to other participants, than existed
at the time of the Change of Control;


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">6
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(g)&nbsp;The failure by a Buyer, the Company or Subsidiary to continue to provide the Employee with
benefits substantially similar to those enjoyed by him or her under any of the Company&#146;s or
Subsidiary&#146;s life insurance, medical, dental, accident or disability plans in which the Employee
was participating at the time of the Change of Control or Subsidiary Change of Control, the taking
of any action by a Buyer, Company or Subsidiary which would directly or indirectly materially
reduce any of such benefits, or the failure by a Buyer, Company or Subsidiary to provide the
Employee with a reasonable amount of paid vacation or paid time off.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(d)&nbsp;The Employee submits an application for benefits to the Company&#146;s head of Human Resources
within 15 business days of the cessation of his or her employment, stating the date of
termination, describing the circumstances of the termination and the reasons he or she believes
benefits are payable under the Plan and submits in a timely manner any additional information
requested by the head of Human Resources, the Benefits Committee or either of their designees that
is reasonably related to consideration of the Employee&#146;s claim for benefits under the Plan; and


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(e)&nbsp;The Employee takes all actions required in a timely manner to apply for and receive
severance or other termination benefits as may be available in connection with his or her
employment after the Change of Control or Subsidiary Change of Control, including benefits from a
Buyer; and


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(f)&nbsp;The Employee duly executes and provides to the Company within the time period specified by
the Company a General Release satisfactory to the Company, which the Employee does not revoke in a
timely manner, if a revocation provision is included in the Company&#146;s sole discretion.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3.2 An Employee may not receive Severance Pay if any of the following disqualifying events
occur:


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;The Employee is receiving severance pay at the time the Change of Control or Subsidiary
Change of Control occurs;


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;The Employee has previously received severance pay under this Plan in connection with a
Subsidiary Change of Control resulting from an agreement or agreements between the Company and a
Buyer or has received from a Buyer amounts equal to or greater than the amounts which would have
been received under this Plan; or


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(c)&nbsp;The Employee has signed an agreement pursuant to which his or her employment will
terminate in the future on a date certain.


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">7
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(d)&nbsp;In the case of an Employee laid off or scheduled to be laid off by the Company or
Subsidiary, the Employee posts for and receives a written offer for any position with the Company
or Subsidiary without regard for the terms of the offer; or


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(e)&nbsp;In the case of an Employer laid off or scheduled to be laid off by the Company or
Subsidiary, the Employee accepts employment (regardless of the terms of employment) with the
Company or any Subsidiary or any Buyer.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt"><B>SECTION 4. </B><U><B>SEVERANCE BENEFIT AMOUNT</B></U>



<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.1 Except as otherwise provided in this Section&nbsp;4, the Severance Pay to be paid to an
eligible Employee shall be based upon the Employee&#146;s AMIP Level as follows: (a)&nbsp;Employees who are
AMIP Level A will receive one hundred and four (104)&nbsp;Weeks of Pay; (b)&nbsp;Employees who are AMIP Level
B shall receive one hundred and four (104)&nbsp;Weeks of Pay; (c)&nbsp;Employees who are AMIP Level C shall
receive fifty-two (52)&nbsp;Weeks of Pay; and (d)&nbsp;Employees who are AMIP Level D shall receive
thirty-nine (39)&nbsp;Weeks of Pay. An Employee&#146;s AMIP Level is to be determined under AMIP as of the
date the Change of Control occurs, as shown in Exhibit &#147;A.&#148;


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.2 The Company, in its sole discretion, may increase the Severance Pay to an amount in excess
of that specified in Section&nbsp;4.1, subject to the limitations of Sections&nbsp;2.12 and 4.6. Any
increase in severance pay must be expressly authorized in writing by the head of Human Resources
for the Company.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.3 If an Employee applies for and receives unemployment compensation payments for any period
of time during or for which Severance Pay is being paid, any Severance Pay remaining to be paid
shall not be reduced by the amount of any such unemployment compensation payments.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.4 If an Employee due to sickness or injury receives short-term disability payments, worker&#146;s
compensation or long-term disability payments after the Employee&#146;s Termination Date, the Employee
shall not receive any Severance Pay until the cessation of said payments. Once said payments
cease, the amount of Severance Pay to which the Employee is entitled shall be reduced by the amount
of any such short-term disability, worker&#146;s compensation or long-term disability payments.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.5 The severance benefit provided for in the Plan is the maximum benefit that the Company or
Subsidiary will pay for severance. To the extent that a federal, state or local law might require
the Company or Subsidiary to make a payment to an Employee because of that Employee&#146;s involuntary
termination, the benefit payable under the Plan shall be correspondingly reduced. To the extent
that an Employee receives, or with the exercise of reasonable diligence would be eligible to
receive, severance pay or any other payment (excluding unemployment compensation) in connection
with the cessation of his or her employment other than pursuant to this Plan (whether pursuant to a
contract or other severance plan, policy or practice), the benefit


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">8
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">payable under this Plan shall be correspondingly reduced. Any overpayments made under the
Plan shall be promptly repaid after written request. Severance pay that will be offset does not
include payments received by an Employee due to his or her participation in the Employee Savings
Plan, Executive Deferral Plan, or any other Company or Subsidiary benefit plan which is not a
severance plan, or payments made to an Employee for his or her accrued, but unused vacation or Paid
Time Off days.



<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.6 If, at the time the Change of Control or Subsidiary Change of Control occurs, Section
280G(b) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended (the &#147;Code&#148;) is applicable to the
Employee, notwithstanding any other provision of this Plan, if the aggregate present value of the
&#147;parachute payments&#148; to the Employee, determined under Section&nbsp;280G(b) is at least three times the
&#147;base amount&#148; determined under such Section&nbsp;280G, then the compensation otherwise payable under
this Plan (and any other amount payable hereunder or any other severance plan, program, policy or
obligation of the Company, Subsidiary or any other affiliate thereof) shall be reduced so that the
aggregate present value of the parachute payments to the Employee determined under Section&nbsp;280G,
does not exceed 2.99 times the base amount. In no event, however, shall any benefit provided
hereunder be reduced to the extent such benefit is specifically excluded by Section&nbsp;280G(b) of the
Code as a &#147;parachute payment&#148; or as an &#147;excess parachute payment.&#148; Any decisions regarding the
requirement or implementation of such reductions shall be made by the tax counsel and accounting
firm retained by the Company at the time the Plan is adopted.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.7 The Company and each Subsidiary shall have the right to take such action as it deems
necessary or appropriate to satisfy any requirements under federal, state or other laws to withhold
or to make deductions from any benefits payable under the Plan.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt"><B>SECTION 5. </B><U><B>DISTRIBUTION OF BENEFITS</B></U>



<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;5.1 The Company and any other entity adopting the Plan shall have exclusive liability for the
payments of any benefits under the Plan with respect to all employees of the Company or any
Subsidiary. No Buyer shall assume any liability under this Plan.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;5.2 The Company and each Subsidiary responsible for making the payments under the Plan will
pay Severance Pay to each eligible Employee it employed, except as otherwise provided above,
directly out of the general assets of the Company or Subsidiary. Payments will be made in a single
lump sum payment or in installments in accordance with normal payroll practices, as elected by the
Employee. Such payments shall commence as soon as practicable following the Employee&#146;s Termination
Date and continue until the benefit due is paid.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;5.3 Any and all payment of Severance Pay shall immediately cease to an Employee who is
disqualified for benefits by reason of Section&nbsp;3.2(d) or 3.2(e) of the Plan.


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">9
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;5.4 Severance Pay shall be paid to the estate of any eligible Employee who dies before the
entire amount due hereunder is paid.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt"><B>SECTION 6. </B><U><B>PLAN ADMINISTRATION</B></U>



<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;6.1 The Plan shall be administered by the Benefits Committee, which shall have complete
authority to prescribe, amend and rescind rules and regulations relating to the Plan.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;6.2 The determinations by the Benefits Committee on the matters referred to such Committee
shall be conclusive. The Benefits Committee shall have full discretionary authority, the maximum
discretion allowed by law, to administer, interpret and apply the terms of this Plan, and determine
any and all questions or disputes hereunder, including but not limited to eligibility for benefits
and the amount of benefits due. Subsequent to a Change of Control, but not a Subsidiary Change of
Control, the Benefits Committee shall not have full discretionary authority; its determinations
shall be made strictly in accordance with the terms of the Plan and shall be subject to de novo
review by a court of competent jurisdiction.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;6.3 In the event of a claim by any person including but not limited to any Employee (the
&#147;Claimant&#148;) as to whether he is entitled to any benefit under the Plan, the amount of any
distribution or its method of payment, such Claimant shall present the reason for his or her claim
in writing to the Benefits Committee. The claim must be filed within forty-five (45)&nbsp;days
following the date upon which the Claimant first learns of his claim. All claims shall be in
writing, signed and dated and shall briefly explain the basis for the claim. The claim shall be
mailed to the Benefits Committee by certified mail at the following address: Advanta Corp., Welsh
and McKean Roads, Spring House, PA 19477. The Benefits Committee shall, within ninety (90)&nbsp;days
after receipt of such written claim, decide the claim and send written notification to the Claimant
as to its disposition; provided that the Benefits Committee may elect to extend said period for an
additional ninety (90)&nbsp;days if special circumstances so warrant and the Claimant is so notified in
writing prior to the expiration of the original ninety (90)&nbsp;day period. In the event the claim is
wholly or partially denied, such written notification shall (a)&nbsp;state the specific reason or
reasons for the denial; (b)&nbsp;make specific reference to pertinent Plan provisions on which the
denial is based; (c)&nbsp;provide a description of any additional material or information necessary for
the Claimant to perfect the claim and an explanation of why such material or information is
necessary; and (d)&nbsp;set forth the procedure by which the Claimant may appeal the denial of his or
her claim. The Claimant may request a review of such denial by making application in writing to
the Benefits Committee within sixty (60)&nbsp;days after receipt of such denial. Said application must
be via certified mail. Such Claimant (or his or her duly authorized representative) may, upon
written request to the Benefits Committee, review any documents pertinent to his or her claim, and
submit in writing issues and comments in support of his or her claim or position. Within sixty
(60)&nbsp;days after receipt of a written appeal, the Benefits Committee shall decide the appeal and
notify the Claimant of the final decision; provided that the Benefits Committee may elect to extend
said sixty (60)&nbsp;day period to up to one hundred twenty (120)&nbsp;days after receipt of the written
appeal. The final decision shall be in writing and shall


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">10
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">include specific reasons for the decision, written in a manner calculated to be understood by
the Claimant, and specific references to the pertinent Plan provisions on which the decision is
based.



<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt"><B>SECTION 7. </B><U><B>PLAN MODIFICATION OR TERMINATION</B></U>



<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;7.1 The Plan may be modified, amended or terminated at any time by the Compensation Committee
of the Board of Directors, the Board of Directors, or its designee, with or without notice. Any
such modification, amendment or termination shall be effective at such date as the Compensation
Committee, the Board of Directors or its designee may determine. If a Change of Control occurs,
the Plan may not be modified, amended or terminated until one (1)&nbsp;year after the Change of Control
occurs.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;7.2 All claims for benefits hereunder, even if raised after termination of the Plan, shall be
determined pursuant to Section&nbsp;6.3, and when acting pursuant thereto, the Benefits Committee shall
retain the authority provided in Section&nbsp;6. Notwithstanding any termination of the Plan, all
Employees who are eligible before the date of termination to receive Severance Pay pursuant to this
Plan shall remain entitled to receive said benefit under the terms and conditions of this Plan.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;7.3 On January&nbsp;1, 2003, the terms of the Plan as amended and restated on December&nbsp;21, 2000
shall cease to be in effect and shall automatically revert to the terms in the Plan as originally
adopted effective March&nbsp;17, 1997, except for sections 6 and 7, which shall remain as amended and
restated on December&nbsp;21, 2000.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt"><B>SECTION 8. </B><U><B>GENERAL PROVISIONS</B></U>



<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;8.1 Nothing herein contained shall be deemed to give any Employee the right to be retained in
the employ of the Company and/or any Subsidiary or to interfere with the right of the Company
and/or Subsidiary to discharge him or her at any time, with or without cause.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;8.2 If any of the positions on the Benefits Committee becomes vacant, either the Chairman of
the Board or President may appoint such person or persons as he or she determines, to carry out the
responsibilities assigned to such position under this Plan, so long as such person was employed by
Advanta Corp. prior to a Change of Control.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;8.3 Except as otherwise provided by law, no right or interest of any Employee under the Plan
shall be assignable or transferable, in whole or in part, either directly or by operation of law
or otherwise, including without limitation by execution, levy, garnishment, attachment, pledge or
in any other manner, but excluding adjudication of incompetency; no attempted assignment or
transfer thereof shall be effective; and no right or interest of any Employee under the Plan shall
be liable for, or subject to, any obligation or liability of such Employee, except to the extent
specifically provided for herein.


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">11
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;8.4 The Plan is unfunded. All benefits payable under the Plan shall be paid out of the
general assets of the entity which employed the Employee at the time the Change of Control or
Subsidiary Change of Control pursuant to which he or she is eligible for benefits hereunder.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;8.5 The Plan shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the Employee Retirement
Income Security Act of 1974, as amended, and to the extent not preempted, the laws of the
Commonwealth of Pennsylvania.


<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;8.6 The Plan is intended to constitute a &#147;welfare plan&#148; under the Employee Retirement Income
Security Act of 1974, as amended, and any ambiguities in the Plan shall be construed to effect that
intent.



<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">12
</DIV>
